commit_message:
Use backend header rather than param to GET shard record type

X-Backend-Record-Type=shard is used when shard ranges are being PUT
to a container. For consistency, use the same with GET requests for
shard ranges, instead of a query param items=shard.

This removes need for gatekeeper to filter out items=* params
from client supplied query strings. That in turn avoids the
slim possibility of breaking third party middleware that
used items= params.

The item param support will be removed in a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idda136b7a896f572c56943f0ae29321fa73af935

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Iffb39524beea75703c4b95d1577c42f4eb8e1930

commit_message:
Ensure cinder has access to tripleo.cnf during db sync.

This file is configured in the cinder.conf database configuration and
so is needed to get correct permission.

Related-To: #1701485
Change-Id: Id7c142e0b2e9d181b2f6f8ffd71fbf65077096bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-07 01:50:14.000000000', 'message': "Utils: fix usage of iso8601_from_timestamp

The commit Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e replaced
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime, As oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()
is deprecated in version '1.6'. So the workaround is to copy
the current implementation from oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()
to utils.py. However, oslo_utils.timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp
is also deprecated in version '1.6' and will be removed in a
future version.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp() to utils.py

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/index.html

Change-Id: Iaea0465527329ac4253828fab88998de8eafc031
Partial-Bug: #1715325

commit_message:
Utils: fix usage of iso8601_from_timestamp

The commit Ib384ae8130dcc6cbd47a837d11ca171ce02ef29e replaced
oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime, As oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()
is deprecated in version '1.6'. So the workaround is to copy
the current implementation from oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime()
to utils.py. However, oslo_utils.timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp
is also deprecated in version '1.6' and will be removed in a
future version.

So the workaround is to copy the current implementation from
oslo_utils.timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp() to utils.py

For more informations:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.utils/latest/reference/timeutils.html

Change-Id: Iaea0465527329ac4253828fab88998de8eafc031
Partial-Bug: #1715325

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2e5d2d4b48aeba90a406b31cb577e46d2f378da8

commit_message:
Fix PTL nomination week

PTL nominations were listed the week of Queens-3, but they actually
do not start until the following week. A little late, but we should
change it to accurately reflect the right point on the schedule.

Change-Id: I60b27b76ca0d2022b1d09bfd3e801fe6de152436

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 19:40:18.000000000', 'message': 'support scanning closed stable branches

The scanner was stopping too soon when reviewing the history of a
branch for which the previous branch had been "closed" by deleting the
branch and tagging it with an -eol tag. This fix treats closed -eol
branches the same way as open stable branches, using new configuration
options to allow projects that use different naming conventions to
have the same benefits.

Change-Id: I8024929a2a95e00df48ce56939d54c1569fe18c5
Fixes-Bug: #1746076
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-01-29 19:53:32.000000000', 'message': 'support scanning closed stable branches

The scanner was stopping too soon when reviewing the history of a
branch for which the previous branch had been "closed" by deleting the
branch and tagging it with an -eol tag. This fix treats closed -eol
branches the same way as open stable branches, using new configuration
options to allow projects that use different naming conventions to
have the same benefits.

Change-Id: I8024929a2a95e00df48ce56939d54c1569fe18c5
Fixes-Bug: #1746076
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
support scanning closed stable branches

The scanner was stopping too soon when reviewing the history of a
branch for which the previous branch had been "closed" by deleting the
branch and tagging it with an -eol tag. This fix treats closed -eol
branches the same way as open stable branches, using new configuration
options to allow projects that use different naming conventions to
have the same benefits.

Change-Id: I8024929a2a95e00df48ce56939d54c1569fe18c5
Fixes-Bug: #1746076
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

cloudkitty does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the TEMPEST_SERVICES setting.

Change-Id: Ica3d142ad1c95379771fc1f045dd7e80ca0452a5
Related-Bug: #1743688

[{'created': '2017-12-03 08:45:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix back button on Firefox

Firefox uses bfcache (back-forward cache) to load
re-visited pages. Adding an window.unload handler
to the page disallows Firefox to store the app state
in cache, so back button will work correctly.
More information can be found here [1].

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history

Change-Id: If023bca7c73f983e55c383856e304379c7b8be3a

commit_message:
Fix back button on Firefox and Safari

Firefox (and Safari) uses bfcache (back-forward cache)
to load re-visited pages. The solution is to force a reload
when page is loaded from bfcache, so back button will work
correctly.
More information can be found here [1] and here [2].

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8788802/prevent-safari-loading-from-cache-when-back-button-is-clicked

Change-Id: If023bca7c73f983e55c383856e304379c7b8be3a
Closes-bug: #1686315

[{'created': '2018-01-11 09:49:34.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused env var during mysql bootstrap

In TripleO we exported the KOLLA_KUBERNETES to skip the cluster
readiness check and workaround a limitation of the mariadb boostrap
script in Kolla that expected MariaDB 10.0 coming from the MariaDB
repository and didn't work with the MariaDB 10.1 from RDO.

Luckily this was fixed in Kolla with
Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5 and we can now remove this
tech debt from t-h-t.

Change-Id: Iba62e436a16ddb3cfc87fc4ec03b599e55841681
Related-Bug: #1740060
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused env var during mysql bootstrap

In TripleO we exported the KOLLA_KUBERNETES to skip the cluster
readiness check and workaround a limitation of the mariadb boostrap
script in Kolla that expected MariaDB 10.0 coming from the MariaDB
repository and didn't work with the MariaDB 10.1 from RDO.

Luckily this was fixed in Kolla with
Ia2acb09e877a586243fc1acb49d8d140cf27d7b5 and we can now remove this
tech debt from t-h-t.

Change-Id: Iba62e436a16ddb3cfc87fc4ec03b599e55841681
Related-Bug: #1740060

commit_message:
Haproxy endpoint resource: set defaults for server_names and IPs

It's not trivial to set the server names and IP addresses for dynamic
haproxy endpoints due to the fact that hiera renders the array as a
string. In order to make this work, we try to be clever and get the
server names and IPs from hiera directly as a default value. This should
work as long as the endpoint uses the same name as the service.

Closes-Bug: #1743626
Change-Id: I51eebfeceb5915fb0add8332c50386f6df93dca5

subject: Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-01-26 16:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-29 13:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-31 03:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 16:25:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc
(cherry picked from commit 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc
(cherry picked from commit 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6)

commit_message:
Remove unused pre_network configuration

This format of pre_network was introduced in ocata but it has been
enhanced with role-specific parameters in pike. And it was not
used in pike. It is now being removed in queens.

Change-Id: Ibe6bec3b76f4771197064bba018b196393180d2b

commit_message:
Select Roles Workflow

This patch adds a workflow that takes a list of role names as
input and populates roles_data.yaml in container in Swift with
respective roles from 'roles directory'.

Change-Id: I6c2a0d120d3e362df1ce1b701597d062783a48a4
Implements: blueprint tripleo-common-select-roles-workflow

Adds UpdateRoles Workflow

This patch adds a workflow and associated actions to update
roles in a deployment plan.

Implements: blueprint update-roles-action

commit_message:
add select.POLLNVAL event when poll register

if select.POLLNVAL event had not been registerd,
poll would never unregistered in handle_stdin
and handle_socket when select.POLLNVAL occured.

Change-Id: I83524dc3262130503ffed66a882063c1aca44407

commit_message:
Add return-request-id-to-caller function

Add return-request-id-to-caller function to Notification,
Host and Segment class.
The methods in these classes return object that has
'request_ids' property.
The caller can get request ids of the callee via the property.

Change-Id: I337fadcb3c828e3fdd65d7337d797e3370072fd7
Implements: bp return-request-id-to-caller

[{'created': '2018-01-11 22:12:40.000000000', 'message': 'Set cloud_name hiera parameter for composable networks

This sets the cloud_name hiera parameter using jinja for all
networks including any custom networks.

It also cleans up hiera parameters for virtual ips that are no
longer being used due to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531037/.
The internal_api_virtual_ip parameter must be kept because its
used for contrail.

Change-Id: I876263d374804e9f032f511112baa5fa7e67b49b
Closes-Bug: 1740953
'}]
commit_message:
Set cloud_name hiera parameter for composable networks

This sets the cloud_name hiera parameter using jinja for all
networks including any custom networks.

It also cleans up hiera parameters for virtual ips that are no
longer being used due to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531037/.
The internal_api_virtual_ip parameter must be kept because its
used for contrail.

Change-Id: I876263d374804e9f032f511112baa5fa7e67b49b
Closes-Bug: 1740953

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 13:37:59.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce tests for yaql structures

We use yaql in many hot templates, but they are usually faily obscure
and not documented, which makes it hard to change them over time (to
make them perform better for example).

This introduces some basic infrastructure for testing them, as well as a
first modification to show how things would be easier to change.

Change-Id: I1a8d3a514d8fa0de4b024d3ae320723d791f3e7d
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce tests for yaql structures

We use yaql in many hot templates, but they are usually faily obscure
and not documented, which makes it hard to change them over time (to
make them perform better for example).

This introduces some basic infrastructure for testing them, as well as a
first modification to show how things would be easier to change.

Change-Id: I1a8d3a514d8fa0de4b024d3ae320723d791f3e7d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 16:53:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use more advanced regular expressions in quickstart.sh

Now for backward compatibility the script converts some node
configuration file names.
For example, a name that contains "ha.yml" is implicitely converted
to "pacemaker.yml": non_ha.yml, ha.yml_bak, alpha.yml, etc.
This approach creates problems and inconveniences.
To avoid it, srictly speaking, we should check the full match of the
file name and ignore all other cases.

Change-Id: I3cd3b6fc5eacdba7d6db164ae7596cce02620ac0
Closes-bug: #1674411
'}]
commit_message:
Use more advanced regular expressions in quickstart.sh

Now for backward compatibility the script converts some node
configuration file names.
For example, a name that contains "ha.yml" is implicitely converted
to "pacemaker.yml": non_ha.yml, ha.yml_bak, alpha.yml, etc.
This approach creates problems and inconveniences.
To avoid it, srictly speaking, we should check the full match of the
file name and ignore all other cases.

Change-Id: I3cd3b6fc5eacdba7d6db164ae7596cce02620ac0
Closes-bug: #1674411

[{'created': '2018-01-25 13:57:31.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder containers: volume and env customizations

This patch will allow custom volume and env variables for the
cinder-volume container.

This is likely going to be needed by some Cinder backends who may not
have in-tree TripleO integration yet and need these types of
customizations.

Change-Id: I825c5373c7c4ab6896579eae705bc034f67fb68f
(cherry picked from commit 7bd89420f27f20b31ef1577579a6e715bcbf8f90)
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder containers: volume and env customizations

This patch will allow custom volume and env variables for the
cinder-volume container.

This is likely going to be needed by some Cinder backends who may not
have in-tree TripleO integration yet and need these types of
customizations.

Change-Id: I825c5373c7c4ab6896579eae705bc034f67fb68f
(cherry picked from commit 7bd89420f27f20b31ef1577579a6e715bcbf8f90)

 shouldn't be unique as different tenants can use the same url and regex

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9f7c6bed957221499d228cd48297b353b9a1f388

Add content parameter for checkpoint and bank modules

Add optional content parameter for checkpoint interface, so that other
checkpoint bank plugin like database bank plugin can be introduced to
Karbor.

Change-Id: I4eaad0b3fe38cb95a668b83acba39cd831bbb7df
Closes-Bug: #1745909

commit_message:
Add 'orchestration' config group for murano tempest

Since I1c02fd88c3d93b511ff4a6b54b668ebd306481a9 this commit
Remove deprecated 'orchestration' config group options,
cause the error in murano tempest test:
tempest.lib.exceptions.UnknownServiceClient: Service clients named orchestration are not known
we should add those config in murano tempest.

Change-Id: I5cd674b94ee472c5b5ab6a9a51170d89880887a4

'ClusterActionName' check, the None not in CLUSTER_ACTION_NAMES

commit_message:
Latest Nexus Configuration Variables Updates

Add new interface Config variables added to Nexus plugin.
    vnc_pool
    intfcfg.portchannel
Identify variables which are obsolete and those being deprecated.
Change default to switch_heartbeat_time.

Depends-On: I940659bdd448b7bda1c38d9343ec6322390b027a

Closes-bug:  #1672493
(cherry picked from commit d11d8155b5521dca841c568346fe7b05b19aa519)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated oslo.messaging.get_transport with get_notification_transport

Warning: Using function/method 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()'
is deprecated: use get_rpc_transport or get_notification_transport.

Change-Id: Ie2668dd63dcf4134601fed93c9332f6c04dbe2c3

commit_message:
Add policy sample file generation

This adds the entry point and config file necessary for using the
oslo.policy sample generation script. It also adds a tox target to
simplify the usage of it.

The command is also run in the docs tox target since the sample file
can be considered documentation.

Change-Id: I6e9a404f9ad12aa77abf79b7729ea6dba951cc82

commit_message:
Remove old puppet ceph hieradata during upgrade

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520017/ introduced a pre upgrade
check for existing puppet-ceph hieradata. In case it is found the
upgrade fails. This change removes the puppet-ceph osd params from
ExtraConfig and then overrides it in an extra env file.

Change-Id: Icc04798f8bde0cd9efe3c7620cdb9a33b2492a74

commit_message:
Update the obs placement-api port

In OpenSuse/SLES/obs the placement-api port used is 8780
however the port in the container-install-obs guide is
currently 8778. Making the instructions wrong.

This patch corrects the port number.

Change-Id: I2b7b80dcad3e0d9d49ed126ac5b01b06ee250081

service-types-authority.  Add it as a service in devstack, with cinder's

commit_message:
Create block-storage endpoint for cinder

block-storage is the official service type for cinder, according to the
service-types-authority.  Add it as a service in devstack, with cinder's
unversioned endpoint, to enable proper discovery.

Change-Id: I75cf7212678f7f270c3c32f0bce227dbbf6b466d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 15:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC",
but on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Closes-bug: #1744160

Change-Id: I505434facc7adc4a479f67eeedb31cf7b4bf7caf
'}]
commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC",
but on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Closes-bug: #1744160

Change-Id: I505434facc7adc4a479f67eeedb31cf7b4bf7caf

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id109926ebe6e44c637f56e52fee30f3dbd4b79df

commit_message:
ProviderTree.new_child: parent is either uuid or name

Change the signature of ProviderTree.new_child to accept either uuid or
name for parent. This way virt drivers can easiy add new children in the
provider tree having only a nodename.

Change-Id: I30b9d5b97f014b38e6fe619e38aebab273525826

Add release note for QEMU native LUKS decryption

Part of blueprint libvirt-qemu-native-luks

Change-Id: Ifad80fbad54e31986af5da265d37b8ce4a01ef10

subject: Add functional test gates
messages:
[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-22 23:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-23 03:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

py35 functional tests times out now, looks like its not executing against python 3.5

http://logs.openstack.org/30/536630/1/check/glance-tox-functional-py35/41fcfaf/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-23_03_50_34_470394'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 08:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

No need for new jobs, use the common ones, please.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:34:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also need to rebase this patch on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536733/ to avoid timeout for 'glance-tox-functional-py35' job"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Let me fix this quickly for you...'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:13:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Is there a problem with the job definition? The reason it is running functional-py35 under py27 is that is what the job is calling:

http://logs.openstack.org/30/536630/1/check/glance-tox-functional-py35/7687db3/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-23_00_10_55_653219'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The tox.ini is the problem - see the stacked change.

I expect this to be fixed with this one.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This should be working fine now, see http://logs.openstack.org/30/536630/3/check/openstack-tox-functional-py35/f817456/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-23_10_11_57_020947'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I'm not clear why changing the environment would change the called command from "tox -e functional" to "tox -e functional-py35". But as the log shows, it does work now so, fair enough.

/me goes to check other repos that used the same convention.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Sean, indeed - multiple problems. The one you pointed out is in patchset 1, see below'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:35:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So... is the parent patch this was rebased on needed. I don't believe it should be."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:36:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

sean, let's try - I'll rebase ;)"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 12:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:06:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

OK, looks like that patch was not needed as this is now running correctly with the py35 virtualenv it should be using.

There's another failure, which appears to actually be a legitimate test failure now."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:52:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Got rid of functional py27 entirely while we're working on the bug.

Not sure what's happening with functional-py35, that test passes in my environment."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:53:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Brian, do you want to add the py27 job as experimental for now? That way you can test it with "check experimental".

But you can also enable it as part of a change if you like...'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:56:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Andreas: that's a good idea, will put up another PS."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 13:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Gate is failing, but I am not able to reproduce the migration test failure locally. I wonder if this is another newer system package side effect.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

From openstack-tox-functional-py35 zuul_info:
/etc/dib-builddate.txt: 2018-01-22 21:42

I can't reproduce this failure locally either, and apt-get dist-upgrade --dry-run is showing that there's nothing new for me on my Ubuntu 16.04.3"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 17:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Maybe make them both non-voting for now? Would kind of be a shame to do that, but...'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-23 19:36:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Let's skip the failing py35 test so we at least have *some* functional test coverage.  I put up patch https://review.openstack.org/536939 for that (with associated bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1745003 ).  We can merge that patch and then recheck this one."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-24 01:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-25 03:31:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-25 03:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-25 04:05:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Looks like the functional gate is failing, not sure why the skip test isn't working."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-25 06:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

py35 failure:

glance.tests.functional.db.migrations.test_ocata_migrate01.TestOcataMigrate01MySQL.test_walk_versions [4.124981s] ... FAILED'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:18:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> py35 failure:
 > 
 > glance.tests.functional.db.migrations.test_ocata_migrate01.TestOcataMigrate01MySQL.test_walk_versions
 > [4.124981s] ... FAILED

Any idea why the skip test isn't working?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

The post_failure comrs from using the py35 environment, we need
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536733/ so that the proper environment is used.

Or our jobs needs changes to handle the envdir variable.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

No idea why the skip is not working ;('}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-26 12:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-26 12:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Rebased on Abhishek's https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536733/ , which just merged."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-26 13:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Still, glance.tests.functional.db.migrations.test_ocata_migrate01.TestOcataMigrate01MySQL.test_walk_versions is failing. Not sure why it is not skipped.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-26 13:52:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

It's still not skipping that test.  Will continue to try to figure this out.

In the meantime, it looks like Erno's https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537951/ will fix the problem with running the py27 tests.  So I will rebase this patch on that one and change this patch to make the py35 experimental and the py27 functional tests run by default."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-26 22:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-27 02:34:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

OK, so glance.tests.functional.db.migrations.test_ocata_migrate01.TestOcataMigrate01MySQL.test_walk_versions is (a) not being skipped and (b) failing in both py27 and py29, though I can't reproduce the failure locally (and that test and a bunch of others are skipped on my dev machine).  Will continue to look into this."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-27 03:01:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-29 00:56:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-29 00:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

This was rebased onto https://review.openstack.org/538694'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-29 03:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-29 03:39:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Failure in tempest-full is RUN END RESULT_TIMED_OUT , not clear what's going on except that it is not related to this change.  This job seems to be failing intermittently.  It's a shame it takes >2 hours to fail, though."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-29 06:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-29 13:15:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Workflow+1

Need this before Q-3, so let's get it in the queue."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-29 17:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-30 12:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-01-30 16:15:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

The dependency this patch is rebased on, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538694/ failed the check; is being rechecked now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 23:52:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test gates

Change I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761 separates out the
functional tests from the unit tests in tox.ini.  Thus the current
gate jobs running them via tox will not longer run functional tests.
So add the jobs to our local .zuul.yaml

The py27 functional job is made non-voting due to bug 1744824.  It
should be restored as soon as that bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I712ac1ca55fc2b592a2ee23ef182d75885c32929
Partial-bug: #1744824
'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 09:42:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add functional test gates

commit_message:
Add functional test gates

Change I93d7216340bef70fc18fc9943da5c740ba3d4761 separates out the
functional tests from the unit tests in tox.ini.  Thus the current
gate jobs running them via tox will not longer run functional tests.
So add the jobs to our local .zuul.yaml

Change-Id: I712ac1ca55fc2b592a2ee23ef182d75885c32929

commit_message:
Skip one functional test

Skip this test until Bug #1745003 is fixed.  It's not a normal
skip; the skipping is done by commenting out the offending
assertions.  That's because I725c228b82efd408b283854c1be2d1bdab33a834
appears to be completely ineffective, probably because of the
mixins used in the db functional tests.

Change-Id: I01bc954fc524d64cfeae67f8d03fe15f998893e6
Related-bug: #1745003

commit_message:
Fix federation unit test

A patch[1] was introduced to demonstrate a bug in federation token
auth[2]. The bug was later fixed[3] but one of the new tests was never
un-WIP'd. It continued to "fail as expected" because it was using a
method that didn't exist, not failing due to the bug it was supposed to
expose. This patch fixes the test and un-WIPs it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229125
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1501032
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/431181/

Change-Id: I4d76362256e41fafc87d413cde090fb12450ec83

I'll update document with a broader SW modules design ."}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-03 16:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 09:17:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-01-04 09:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Yossi, thank you for the detailed explanation. 
Regarding the Kuryr Ingress, based on your proposal, it can be either single logical L7 Router with multiple rules or multiple L7 routers. I think the used terminology is a bit confusing, worth to stick to the current Kuryr terms. There is currently single Kuryr service/Controller that serves watchers and handlers that use drivers to fulfill the job. worth to stress that L7 Router is totally logical entity that eventually is translated into L7 LB/Pool. I also think that persisting the L7 Router into the node annotation is a bit tricky. If we go forward with this abstraction, why not keep it as a CRD in K8s model?'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 10:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 10:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Hi Irena,

I've added detailed flow diagram for L7 router and Ingress creation, Hope it will clarify things.

1. For kuryr-k8s ingress controller, I think we should have a single L7 router , that will serve all Ingress/Endpoints. I'll clarify it in document.
Please let me know if it's still unclear.

2. As per SW context that kuryr-k8s Ingress controller should run in , I think it could be good idea if we"ll have a separate controller for that purpose. what do u think ?
3. I also thought about having CRD for L7 routers, but since I don't know if we should support the multiple 
L7 routers use case in Openshift case
I decided to keep this part simple , and rely on Node's annotation at least at this phase.

So ,I think we"ll have the following :
A.  Ingress controller design
B. Openshift Router design
C. Generic code to support  L7 Router (and maybe separate controller)
D. Openshift code for OCP-Route controller (including codebase separation)

We can move to CRD for L7 Routers , what Do you think ?'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2018-01-04 12:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 12:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 12:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(4 comments)

Hi Irena,
See comments inside, and also updated the neutron entities scheme 
to include both L7 router LB and User LB entities.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-04 13:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-08 07:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-09 12:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-01-10 14:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2018-01-11 12:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

messages: [{'account_id': 21714, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-31 07:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 21:44:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tftpd-hpa configuration issues

  This includes:
    - removing two bad /etc/default/tftpd-hpa tasks
    - relocating the good /etc/default/tftpd-hpa task
      to the pre-tasks area of the broken configs.
    - Removing OPTIONS from /etc/default/tftpd-hpa as they
      were causing duplicate -s config errors. The -l is
      taken care of in the init script as well.

Change-Id: Ie474fceb116c921a373f5711194e222594095e51
Closes-Bug: 1746354
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tftpd-hpa configuration issues

  This includes:
    - removing two bad /etc/default/tftpd-hpa tasks
    - relocating the good /etc/default/tftpd-hpa task
      to the pre-tasks area of the broken configs.
    - Removing OPTIONS from /etc/default/tftpd-hpa as they
      were causing duplicate -s config errors. The -l is
      taken care of in the init script as well.

Change-Id: Ie474fceb116c921a373f5711194e222594095e51
Closes-Bug: 1746354

commit_message:
Modify the file,it will be more effective

horizon/workflows/base.py get_help_text,
It is really bad writing,
firstly declare a variable for nothing,
then concatenate two string variable.

After modification:we set the result directly.
then,because if and else,so text is sure to be assigned
finally return text

Change-Id: I67aaf2e6259498d3470a7fa001f48f3316f9fc28
Signed-off-by: peiy <peiy@rc.inesa.com>

commit_message:
‘local_pref’ can be updated in 'test_bgpvpn_create_update_delete()'

'allow_put' for 'local_pref' attribute to BGPVPN resource  is True.
‘local_pref’ can be updated in 'test_bgpvpn_create_update_delete()'

commit_message:
Added NOVA Placement API Client and unit tests.
This feature is used for updating the placement DB on NOVA side
Cyborg DB should be kept up to date with the placement DB all
the time.

Here is an example on how to use it:

    from cyborg.services import report as placement_report_client
    p_client = placement_report_client.SchedulerReportClient()

    resource_provider = {'name': 'rp_name', 'uuid': 'uuid'}
    p_client.create_resource_provider(resource_provider)

Change-Id: I04f5e3fc283074212841e62dde54df496db535ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-20 08:37:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the bug that can not create a loadbalancer policy with
exists loadbalancer

Failed to create a loadbalancer policy with the error
message "AttributeError: 'NeutronClient' object has no
attribute 'loadbalancer_get'".

And then I found it's an error call in policies/base.py,
it should call octavia() rather than network().

Closes-Bug: #1744437
Change-Id: I7aabfd0c339339ca5fdc6ff679700ca28b56bc4e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that can not create a loadbalancer policy with
exists loadbalancer

Failed to create a loadbalancer policy with the error
message "AttributeError: 'NeutronClient' object has no
attribute 'loadbalancer_get'".

And then I found it's an error call in policies/base.py,
it should call octavia() rather than network().

Closes-Bug: #1744437
Change-Id: I7aabfd0c339339ca5fdc6ff679700ca28b56bc4e

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

When adding a new rule to a secruity group that would exceede the
quota, the error message displays a quota error, rather than rule
already exists error. It does this my first checking for an

commit_message:
Security group quota error handling

When adding a new rule to a secruity group that would exceede the
quota, the error message displays a quota error, rather than rule
already exists error. It does this my first checking for an
"OverQuotaClient" error, then if that except doesn't trigger it
checks for any other conflict

Change-Id: I8eaa0f00b25c8c3b75fef2bf46979f1f248c6896
Closes-Bug: #1699724

Fix until_complete parameter in nova crons

The until_complete paramenter needs to be translated
correctly to the CLI option --until-complete instead of
--until_complete.

Closes-Bug: 1745120
(cherry picked from commit 7a1931cd63eeabf53b2472f47681e33dc29980bf)

commit_message:
restart the containers after the host reboot

Some containers are running in a host. If the host reboots,
all the running containers will be stopped.
It's better to restart them when zun-compute works.

Change-Id: I7442110fc453e0fa8760038ce213689e630347d2
Implements:blueprint restart-container-when-host-reboot

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 21:05:56.000000000', 'message': 'Enable automatic restart of memcached, apache and mongodb

Prior to Newton, HA deployments had automatic restart of non-Openstack
services on controller nodes. From Newton onward, after we switched to
systemd for the vast majority of services, Openstack services are
configured for automatic restart, but memcached apache and mongodb
lack it.

Generate a drop-in file for the mentioned services, so they can
restart automatically in both HA and non-HA deployments.

This change differs slighly from the review backported to Ocata [1]
because in Newton, there is no tripleo-specific profile to configure
Apache; So we generate the drop-in file in the keystone profile to
guarantee that Apache automatic restart will be enabled on nodes where
OpenStack API are deployed.

[1] I7658f539db55b7416a9931822cfe2102c3388123

Change-Id: Ic6b57ec30c53a077eb83afd5c99f5c59e6ff56d3
Closes-Bug: #1741263
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Enable automatic restart of memcached, apache and mongodb

Prior to Newton, HA deployments had automatic restart of non-Openstack
services on controller nodes. From Newton onward, after we switched to
systemd for the vast majority of services, Openstack services are
configured for automatic restart, but memcached apache and mongodb
lack it.

Generate a drop-in file for the mentioned services, so they can
restart automatically in both HA and non-HA deployments.

This change differs slighly from the review backported to Ocata [1]
because in Newton, there is no tripleo-specific profile to configure
Apache; So we generate the drop-in file in the keystone profile to
guarantee that Apache automatic restart will be enabled on nodes where
OpenStack API are deployed.

[1] I7658f539db55b7416a9931822cfe2102c3388123

Change-Id: Ic6b57ec30c53a077eb83afd5c99f5c59e6ff56d3
Closes-Bug: #1741263
Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

[{'created': '2018-01-29 22:05:21.000000000', 'message': 'Use relative path in ipv6 nic configs

The path to run-os-net-config.sh in these nic config templates for ci
should be relative, not absolute. The absolute path does not honor a
different directory specified via --templates, and it also fails the
overcloud deploy entirely b/c the absolute path does not exist in the
plan in swift.

Change-Id: I85ac081571965f42beef4bd283db985b9a03078f

'}]
commit_message:
Use relative path in ipv6 nic configs

The path to run-os-net-config.sh in these nic config templates for ci
should be relative, not absolute. The absolute path does not honor a
different directory specified via --templates, and it also fails the
overcloud deploy entirely b/c the absolute path does not exist in the
plan in swift.

Change-Id: I85ac081571965f42beef4bd283db985b9a03078f
(cherry picked from commit c74318381c91751e0f43f1b99f26011cecafe440)
(cherry picked from commit ff1076e847ff7baa962e96973225a91f87155c65)

commit_message:
Update nova::compute::libvirt for bug 1720787

Nova compute was missed in the backporting of the related patch.
This resulted in the correct acls for the nova user not being applied.
This patch adds code missed by patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517347/

Change-Id: Ie968e6abc6969c37be0a62ac45999093120673d4
Related-Bug: 1720787

commit_message:
Deprecated error method

$http's deprecated custom callback method: .error() has been
removed in AngularJS 1.6. Use the standard .catch() promise
method instead.

Change-Id: I3fb233daddd1af6161a8e134b5902bb0264d2a95

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib61a6f00eba2a60aa35d232e6f65ce2f4a839222

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 22:05:48.000000000', 'message': 'Add SELinux policies for bare metal agents

The recent move to bare metal neutron agents brought the processes
spawned by each agent under the watch of SELinux policies. This
patch ensures that neutron can still start important daemons, such
as dnsmasq or haproxy, without causing SELinux AVCs.

Closes-Bug: 1742552
Change-Id: Id1ae9d2b43cd0fb4c38460501da24733b29566e2
'}, {'created': '2018-01-11 13:51:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add SELinux policies for bare metal agents

The recent move to bare metal neutron agents brought the processes
spawned by each agent under the watch of SELinux policies. This
patch ensures that neutron can still start important daemons, such
as dnsmasq or haproxy, without causing SELinux AVCs.

commit_message:
Add SELinux policies for bare metal agents

The recent move to bare metal neutron agents brought the processes
spawned by each agent under the watch of SELinux policies. This
patch ensures that neutron can still start important daemons, such
as dnsmasq or haproxy, without causing SELinux AVCs.

Closes-Bug: 1742552
Change-Id: Id1ae9d2b43cd0fb4c38460501da24733b29566e2

commit_message:
Remove the invalid toctree

The reference to v2/index doesn't exist, causing the build to fail.
Given the api-ref documentation is currently empty, removing the toctree
wont cause any issues.

This makes the build green (test with `tox -e api-ref`), which will allow CI to
be enabled which may help further work on the api-ref.

Change-Id: I9893c3f629255ae2ae879a60fa341e3775b426ed

If we decide that we want to make this change, I'd argue that (1) it's an enhancement, and (2) it needs to be controlled by either configuration or policy, because allowing deletion of a deactivated image is up to the deployer, not up to Glance.  For example, depending upon how billing is done in a cloud, a deployer may not want it to be the case that a user is being charged for an image that the user cannot use.

Anyway, I'd like to see some more discussion of this."}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2015-12-11 17:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I don't think this is something we can consider a bug and let it in. I'd like to see a proper spec for it as it's effectively changing the behavior of our API (sure using a config option) and it's adding a new config option.

I've seen some patches around the deactivation "feature" in the last release and I'm starting to wonder if that's thought thoroughly enough and whether we might need a proper spec to "fix it" or "enhance it".

Thanks, Niall.'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-03-03 12:03:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Flavio I did wonder If this now needed a spec after adding a config option. I thought it would be best to push it up and see what others thought.

In situations like this is it normal practice to propose a new spec or modify the current spec that covers the deactivation feature?

I agree here we have too many config options. I'm not sure what the best policy to resolve this would be based on some members of the community wanting to keep the status quo."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-03 23:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 8158, 'date': '2016-03-08 18:04:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I don't like adding another config option for this. 

How about this random thought. Instead of yet another config option, how about governing the deletion of deactivated images through policy?
We already have a 'deactivate' policy that governs who can deactivate a certain image. That very policy should also be able to govern who can delete the deactivated images as well. Because, that is precisely what we want here, right? We want only those people who deactivated the image be able to delete the deactivated image as well. 

So, why not enforce the same policy here?

 if image['status'] == 'deactivated':
     self._enforce(req, 'deactivate')

Does that make any sense?"}, {'account_id': 8158, 'date': '2016-03-08 18:05:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Enforcing 'deactivate' policy for deletion maybe a tad confusing though, I must admit."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2016-03-08 18:35:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think Hemanth is onto something.  Suppose you add this:

    if image['status'] == 'deactivated':
        self._enforce(req, 'delete_deactivated_image')

I'm pretty sure that if a policy isn't mentioned in the policy.json, anyone is allowed to do it.  So if no changes are made to policy.json, an operator would have the current behavior.  What's nice about a policy instead of a config option is that it gives an operator more options about who can do the action.  With the config option, you have simply either (a) an admin and nobody else can do it, or (b) an admin and everyone else can do it.  With a policy, an operator could add a security team role to some non-admin users who could also do the action (probably not a good example in this context, but you get the point)."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2016-03-09 11:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I think I like the policy idea better.

The question now is: Should we add a new one or re-use the one we have? At this point, I'm leaning towards using the same one, mostly for consistency reasons.

Using `deactivate` for one thing and then `delete_deactivate` for another thing might be super confusing. We can rename the policy in the future if we need to.

The important thing is that the current behavior mustn't change.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2016-03-09 13:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The problem with using the same policy for both is that I don't see how you can preserve the current behavior.

Current behavior: 'deactivate' is admin only, 'delete' (even of a deactivated image) is admin-or-owner.

I could see a use case for making 'deactivate' admin-or-owner, namely, a user could share an image, get a report that there's a problem, and deactivate it on his own while he investigates ...  except, we certainly don't want to make 'reactivate' admin-or-owner, so this would leave a user with the ability to pull an image out of circulation, but not have the ability to put it back into circulation.  Thus, a responsible image owner would have to call support no matter to get an image active again, might as well let a responsible image owner call support in the first place to deactivate an image if a problem is suspected.

On the third hand, my comment on the original bug was that the current behavior is exactly as originally designed, i.e., there had been discussion at the time of the blueprint (I think this was pre-spec-days), and this was the agreed-upon behavior.  So I didn't think we should change the behavior without further discussion.  Maybe someone should circulate an email on the operators' list to see if any actual operators have an opinion on this?  While the ability to deactivate an image was a high-priority operator request, it would be interesting to know how many people actually use it, and what they think of tying the deactivate-image and delete-deactivated-image policies tightly together.  (Personally, I think it makes sense to keep them separate, but I'm open-minded.)"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2016-03-09 18:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Let's wait until Newton before we do this. The reason being, there seem to be quite a few options to fix this issue and it doesn't look like it's critical enough for us to rush a "fix" for it, which is not the ideal one.

If someone disagrees, please do let me know.'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-03-10 10:23:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'm happy to leave to Newton. As its causing a discussion on what the best way to do it is, better not to rush."}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-03-14 14:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-14 15:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.policy/api.html'}, {'account_id': 11356, 'date': '2016-07-17 18:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-07-18 09:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

@Brian Yeah that is correct. Sorry, I wrote my comment but forgot to hit reply.'}, {'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2016-07-18 18:24:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

We don't need to check that policy in code TBH and it can be managed by users.
For example, you can specify the following rule in /etc/policy.json:
delete_deactivated_image: 'deactivated':%(status)s' and rule:context_is_admin or not 'deactivated':%(status)s
delete_image: rule: delete_deactivated_image ..
See more examples for Glare:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/343777/1/glance/common/glare/policy.py
In that case policy will be applied to the case you are trying to achieve. 
So maybe we should stop introduce new policies and use existing functionality. What do you think, guys?"}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-07-19 09:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

@Kairat This did have a spec lite that was merged here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301015/.

However about your point, to me at least, that looks like an overly complicated way to do it. I think it would benefit the users much more to be able to easily see what policy has what effect.

When implementing rules like this the more simple it is the less likely a mistake will be made and a potential security situation will arise.'}, {'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2016-07-19 09:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2016-07-19 09:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2016-07-19 09:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Yep, I saw that spec merged. Nevertheless, we need to implement the best solution despite the fact that spec was merged.
The rule doesn't seem complex to me to be honest and this is the kind of case that policy must cover. The separate policy is simple but from the other point of view it gets messy because delete_image policy doesn't cover all cases for deletion and users need to know that delete_deactivated_image policy also must be updated to manage image deletion. Additionally, if users NOW have an instrument to manage deletion of deactivated images why do we need to duplicate that? So could you please clarify why do we need to duplicate functionality now and support it forever because once this policy will be release we cannot delete it.
Nevertheless, it is community so the points above describe only my opinion=)"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2016-07-19 14:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

I think Kairat raises a very good point, so downgrading to +1 for now.  Let's discuss this at the Glance meeting this week.  Sorry to do this to you Niall, since as you point out, the spec was accepted.

I think the downside of Kairat's suggestion is that if we leave it up to the operator to write the rules, the operator may miss an edge case or something, whereas with the in-code solution, we have tests to verify that the particular behavior of interest is enforced based on that policy.  So I think if we take the operator-configuration route, we should probably write a "cookbook" for how to configure the policy file to achieve specific use-cases, and then we could also have tests to make sure the behavior is correct for the documented use-case.  But this might be more of a pain than introducing/maintaining a specific policy-per-use-case.

I really don't know, I think this could use some discussion.'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-07-19 15:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

@Kiarat Thinking about this some more. Will your method will not allow, a group that is non-admin delete images that they don't own? Because this was the aim of this patch rather than a pure restrictive measure.

For example even with "delete_image": "" limits a user to only deleting their own image. It would not allow a non-admin security group come along and delete another users image?'}, {'account_id': 14676, 'date': '2016-07-19 16:24:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

please see how nova did it:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policies/base.py#L24
I think we can do the same.'}, {'account_id': 17116, 'date': '2016-07-20 15:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Workflow-1

Tested again and looks a bit out of date now.

@Kiarat However a policy can't add more permissions to something. If I have delete_images: "" which should be everything. A user is restricted to still deleting their own images or if they are an admin (which is tested in code as far as i understand). So i don't think it is possible currently as it does not allow for more than if you set everything to anybody.

So to be able to implement this same functionality we would have to have delete_images mean ALL images and then could do delete_images:"there own and if in this group deactivated".'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2016-08-25 05:15:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

I don't think we can afford to move ahead with this in Newton now that we've it in -W and a few other important patches lined up. Please push for this in Ocata. Thanks!"}]

commit_message:
Introduce a policy to govern the deletion of deactivated images

This checks if the image is in a 'deactivated' state and the users
credentials are tested against the policy `delete_deactivated_image`.
If the test passes the user is allowed to delete the deactivated image.

If an image is deactivated it may be useful to only allow certain users
to delete the image so the image can't be destroyed before
investigation.

Spec-Lite: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301015/
Change-Id: I19b516ffb90cfd6a1cb8f1c43e7a1ccbb7424a18
Closes-Bug: 1522524

commit_message:
Default verbosity to 1 if no verbosity_level available

This makes sure that we pass valid values to the config_download
workflow.

Change-Id: Id605b9461177398b6c146beef3f694083783b12f

commit_message:
Update function named _wait_volumes_available

When a volume is not available, it should set count to 0 and sleep.
If not, the count maybe larger than length of volumes in some
situation.

Change-Id: Ifb28cd4be212284ce833b68b31725a84077215dc

commit_message:
Functional tests: Leave fixtures to remove the dbs

We do not need to explicitly remove the databases like before, the
fixtures temporary directory will do that for us at the end of the test
execution.

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: Ia93558845ffdb8ecfa818f1369bf67744894f47f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-28 20:50:55.000000000', 'message': 'i18n: Allow translator to control the word order (trunk)

"<IP address> on subnet <subnet>" format in "Parent Port" and
"Subports" tabs in "Create Trunk" and "Edit Trunk" form did not
allow translators to control the word order because only "on subnet"
was marked as translation string and they are concatenated.

This commit improves the translation string by using the "translate
parameters" feature of Angular gettext.

Also "on subnet" in the "Network Ports" tab of "Create Instance"
workflow is now marked as translation string.

Change-Id: I189897eee8037466ace2b68b8f9be3dc242c4252
Closes-Bug: #1745873
'}]
commit_message:
i18n: Allow translator to control the word order (trunk)

"<IP address> on subnet <subnet>" format in "Parent Port" and
"Subports" tabs in "Create Trunk" and "Edit Trunk" form did not
allow translators to control the word order because only "on subnet"
was marked as translation string and they are concatenated.

This commit improves the translation string by using the "translate
parameters" feature of Angular gettext.

Also "on subnet" in the "Network Ports" tab of "Create Instance"
workflow is now marked as translation string.

Change-Id: I189897eee8037466ace2b68b8f9be3dc242c4252
Closes-Bug: #1745873

commit_message:
Add taskflow to requirements

The powervm driver is dependent on taskflow, but that was not
indicated in requirements.txt. This corrects that omission.

Change-Id: Ic9a9376ae8e5054366f565175c797885b4e83c39

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Add support for storing capsule addresses and volumes_info

Store the capsule addresses and volumes_info to capsule
database. Kubernetes connector will need this info from
Gophercloud.

Part of blueprint golang-client

Change-Id: Idaa7a35bc76abb9ddb9fce4780f7ea0db62a7678
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

messages:

I will update the patch later.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-01-29 03:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-29 15:31:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-29 16:42:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Hi Shengqin,

I got the following error when trying this patch:

  Docker internal error: 500 Server Error: Internal Server Error ("--storage-opt is supported only for overlay over xfs with 'pquota' mount option").

Then, I think we need to check the following (if --disk option is used):

* Verify the storage driver is overlay or overlay2
* Verify the backing filesystem is xfs
* Verify the kernel has project quota support.

If the check failed, the Zun API server should return 501 (NotImplemented).

However, above can be done in a separated patch. What we need is a tech-debt bug to track this issue.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

A comment inline. Besides it, this patch looks good.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:50:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks,hongbin. I will update the pacth after the other bug[1] is mergerd for generating a new db version.

commit_message:
Limit the amount of disk of container

The patch supports the storage_opt size=xxx when run/create
a container. If user set this option, it can limit the size
of the hard disk per container.

Change-Id: I7b4b8a9472d3eaa08f8611400d4ed59e552a9b38
Part of blueprint limit-container-diskspace

commit_message:
Lifecycle hook implementation

* Added lifecycle hook properties to deletion policy
* Check if deletion policy has lifecycle hook properties during
deletion and perform lifecycle specific actions if it does
* Added complete lifecycle API endpoint
* Bumped microversion to 1.9
* Added unit-test cases for lifecycle hooks
* Added lifecycle hook notification
* Added lifecycle hook properties to deletion policy
* Modified node_action to process policy preop if it was a
derived action with lifecycle hook properties
* Modified LB policy to defer deletion of node until node_deletion
action is executed if lifecycle hook properties are defined in
deletion policy
* Added zaqar test driver
* Added documentation for lifecycle hook

Depends-On: Id7804abc351c063563b58fb69a66074d0d854ecf

Change-Id: I888a01c4f26959649121d6f82430017858a4c481

commit_message:
Add support for preparing rescue ramdisk in iLO PXE

Adds support to prepare rescue ramdisk to 'ilo-pxe' boot
interface, which is a subclass of 'pxe' boot interface by
adding the new argument.

Change-Id: Ie486476bfb2ef3ccb30e4b3bb13ec2ee350bfcfd
Related-Bug: #1526449

commit_message:
Switch the CI to hardware types

Note that the job names are not changed to reduce the diff of this
patch. They will be renamed in later changes.

For the direct deploy, copy Swift temporary URL configuration from
devstack-gate (it hardcoded agent_* there).

Also clean up no-op conditions on drivers left from the times when
the job definitions were parametrized.

Change-Id: Ib0297f8936bba9449a02fb1a878981ab55687ef9
Partial-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1b895e5d34c85aad728307e103d457b840cae9fe

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib3f0c76ddd2bed3ab382820be35162b6a1fde479

commit_message:
Release neutron-vpnaas for queens

neutron-vpnaas is back to the neutron stadium in late Queens and
missed the deadline of the cycle-with-milestone projects.
We use the cycle-with-intermediary release model for Queens.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5d8256cc94005dba44f7225cdf47584a528f0ac5

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-25 19:33:36.000000000', 'message': "Let OVS to connect to the individual IPs of each ODL node

Close-Bug: 1734047

For ODL clustering, one should explicitly points switches to each
of the ODL instances. The openflowplugin logic will figure out
which controller should be the master, and which should be the
slave.

Kolla currently sets the manager to one of the specific ODL over
ptcp and another one through the VIP. The VIP is probably
forwarding the traffic to that same ODL so from ODL's perspective
it's getting two duplicated connection requests from the same OVS
which will cause re-connection problem.

This PS does:
1) Let OVS to connect to the individual IPs of each ODL node in
a ODL cluster instead of only connect to the representative over
VIP. Devstack is doing the same thing[1]. Further more, there is no
need for HAProxy to be frontend for ODL southbound.

2) Delete the unusd ptcp connection option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249484/

Change-Id: Ib57e6fbb5ce64a48be0506904d3c8397ed6f70d9
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhijiang@zte.com.cn>
(cherry picked from commit 28b50c22ceb2d9e1b797fe748c61363ec550b9a3)

commit_message:
Let OVS to connect to the individual IPs of each ODL node

For ODL clustering, one should explicitly points switches to each
of the ODL instances. The openflowplugin logic will figure out
which controller should be the master, and which should be the
slave.

Kolla currently sets the manager to one of the specific ODL over
ptcp and another one through the VIP. The VIP is probably
forwarding the traffic to that same ODL so from ODL's perspective
it's getting two duplicated connection requests from the same OVS
which will cause re-connection problem.

This PS does:
1) Let OVS to connect to the individual IPs of each ODL node in
a ODL cluster instead of only connect to the representative over
VIP. Devstack is doing the same thing[1]. Further more, there is no
need for HAProxy to be frontend for ODL southbound.

2) Delete the unusd ptcp connection option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/249484/

Closes-Bug: #1734047
Change-Id: Ib57e6fbb5ce64a48be0506904d3c8397ed6f70d9
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhijiang@zte.com.cn>
(cherry picked from commit 28b50c22ceb2d9e1b797fe748c61363ec550b9a3)

commit_message:
Add release notes for the migration of Ceph env files to containers

The pre-existing environment files which used to enable the
deployment of Ceph on baremetal are now migrated to deploy
Ceph in containers instead.

Also see change I1dea3b7665dc0da2ab30a89e077ba36cd36b05fd

Related-Bug: 1744714
Change-Id: I8fe56227fe83345178f728d7ae15d7c8fbafb11b

 > Ok then can you please clarify why we're special-casing this

 > replicate this pattern over all other services?

we have 2 levels of minor updates, each having different steps. This is for level1 update. Next step is to figure out a way to trigger these levels and write steps for level2"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-09-14 12:34:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> we have 2 levels of minor updates, each having different steps. This is for level1 update. Next step is to figure out a way to trigger these levels and write steps for level2

Sorry but it's still not clear to me - you're not supposed to use update_tasks to do out of band management of containers that are launched by paunch, you're supposed to just update the json (which happens automatically) then let paunch restart the containers.

The level 1 and level 2 updates thing is confusing, perhaps you can provide some links as to why odl needs to be treated specially here - is it because the update must happen before all other services?

The idea for minor updates was really that we just re-run the normal deploy steps, then paunch figures out which containers have definitions that changed, then restarts them - IMHO we're doing something wrong if any services need this kind of manual step logic, although as Marios mentioned we had to do some things with pacemaker managed containers because paunch doesn't know anything about them."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-20 11:33:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 07:10:42.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade/Update ODL

Minor update (within Q) and major upgrade (Q -> R) is complex in ODL.
There are multiple components involved. Dependening on the source code
change, minor update for ODL has 2 sets of steps. We call these level1
and level2. Levl1 steps are simple: stop ODL, preserve DB, update and
start. Level2 minor update steps are same to major upgrade steps.

This patch enables major upgrade of ODL. Steps involved are:
1. stop ODL
2. Block OVS from connecting to ODL (iptables)
3. Update ODL
4. Set ODL upgrade flag to true
5. start ODL and wait for it to come up
6. Trigger full resync from networking-odl
7. Wait for full sync to finish (fuzzy logic. poll # of neutronports
   in neutron and in odl and compare)
8. Unblock ovs connections
9. set upgrade flag to false

Change-Id: Icf98a1215900762a0677aabee1cccbf1d130e5bd
'}, {'created': '2018-01-18 10:01:13.000000000', 'message': 'Upgrade ODL

commit_message:
Upgrade ODL

Major upgrade (Q -> R) is complex in ODL. There are multiple components
involved.

This patch enables major upgrade of ODL. Steps involved are:
1. Block OVS instances to connect to ODL
2. Set ODL upgrade flag to True
3. Start ODL
4. Start Neutron re-sync and wait for it to finish
5. Delete OVS groups and ports
6. Stop OVS
7. Unblock OVS ports
8. Start OVS
9. Unset ODL upgrade flag

Change-Id: Icf98a1215900762a0677aabee1cccbf1d130e5bd

commit_message:
Can not delete loadbalancer when detaching lb_policy

When detaching lb_policy attached to a cluster, the loadbalancer was not
deleted after the lb_policy was detached successfully.
And modify unit test related.
Change-Id: Icbc4650b81921d81eb822941ba7230f6a6805533
Closes-Bug: #1746172

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I126b1f475614b7368ce76426ab1d7f61c8fbf4af

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I714dda40195523388c1b05a6ec0aa12f1f78cb41

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Iff03f999769671adafdb46b22c64e80708d62d0e

'}, {'created': '2018-01-30 18:10:34.000000000', 'message': 'Mock check_dir in ansible interface tests

some tests set a fake tmpdir in config and it may fail during impitool
interface init when creating a task object while checking that this
dir actually exists.

Change-Id: I0d04ca944fe0daf9cc9a8e0ba0fded71733a32be
'}]
commit_message:
Mock check_dir in ansible interface tests

some tests set a fake tmpdir in config and it may fail during impitool
interface init when creating a task object while checking that this
dir actually exists.

Change-Id: I0d04ca944fe0daf9cc9a8e0ba0fded71733a32be

commit_message:
Sort node traits in comparisons

Don't assume that node traits in API responses will be sorted. While
this seems to be the case with mysql, it is not guaranteed for
postgresql.

Change-Id: I8f2afe6a3194203230e3f1cd2fee22190ff3be9f
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Pin netaddr to 1.x

2.x is not compatible with 1.x
See https://github.com/dspinhirne/netaddr-rb/issues/5

Change-Id: If4de157d4419ca68554e68287471444914a9104f
(cherry picked from commit 1589fde0d3681b4338b2a3822fad66b5268a894c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 01:30:09.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=1.12.0

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but
on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values.

Change-Id: Idfefd41e45727a375a5ea296a3348716c43f17b5
Closes-bug: #1744160

commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but
on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values.

Change-Id: Idfefd41e45727a375a5ea296a3348716c43f17b5
Closes-bug: #1744160

commit_message:
block sphinx 1.6.6

A behavior change in Sphinx 1.6.6 breaks the documentation build for
several projects that are automatically generating
documentation. Drop the constraint to the previous version and block
1.6.6 until we can sort out how to deal with the change.

https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/2d99648e9982325bbd670da11df5f809e3134284

Change-Id: I12e4a3f8ec0065209ef4a0052613e8b3ad8f1d99

commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: Ibd50299ee287c56ec4759ea8ff53d47d006144f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 06:52:35.000000000', 'message': "Use tenant_network if any in testcases after microversion v2.37

Now in testcases after microversion v2.37, if networks isn't passed
to create_test_server explicitly, no tenant_network will be retrieved
automatically, so they will always use networks='none'.

This is to use tenant_network if any be can found in testcases
after microversion v2.37 if networks='none' is not explicitly specified.
(if networks='none' is explictly specified, we should use it
prior to using tenant_network)

Change-Id: I0955e3507739e8e50384ba2cb2b56bd00b82750f

commit_message:
Use tenant_network if any in testcases after microversion v2.37

Now in testcases after microversion v2.37, if networks isn't passed
to create_test_server explicitly, no tenant_network will be retrieved
automatically, so they will always use networks='none'.

This is to use tenant_network if any be can found in testcases
after microversion v2.37 if networks='none' is not explicitly specified.
(if networks='none' is explictly specified, we should use it
prior to using tenant_network)

Change-Id: I0955e3507739e8e50384ba2cb2b56bd00b82750f

commit_message:
Add flannel and weave support in ko.py

Add flannel and weave support in ko.py, since the default
network driver is not supported on non-x86 platform. Also
add a params network-driver to set the network driver for
user.

Jira: ENTWLS-516

Partial-Bug: #1738317

Change-Id: Iad90ce96030111a2adfb8a35da06f50d39d0b079
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>
