subject: Add a return code check to the osa wrapper
messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-29 22:07:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-29 22:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:48:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 22:07:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add a return code check to the osa wrapper

Due to our use of block/rescue pattern in some of the playbooks/roles
the after run report will show something "failed" even when the run
succeeds. This creates a poor user experience when looking at the
playbook runs, especially as a new user. This change adds a simple
return code check when the openstack-ansible wrapper is used and reports
if the run succeeds or is a failure based on the RC. This should help
users understand when something actually fails, at a glance.

> NOTE: This change should no longer be needed as soon as we're able
  to move to ansible 2.5 which improves the UX when the block/rescue
  pattern is used.

With this change a user will see an "EXIT NOTICE" which is reported in a
way that resembles how ansible reports information on a playbook run
which should be simple to see and understand in almost all cases.

Change-Id: Ic54a7524c09a170e20830c5f8d2c2a0658159ed0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit f0d8ffd5c147fe07335b55ee0f04785a22871e5c)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a return code check to the osa wrapper

Due to our use of block/rescue pattern in some of the playbooks/roles
the after run report will show something "failed" even when the run
succeeds. This creates a poor user experience when looking at the
playbook runs, especially as a new user. This change adds a simple
return code check when the openstack-ansible wrapper is used and reports
if the run succeeds or is a failure based on the RC. This should help
users understand when something actually fails, at a glance.

> NOTE: This change should no longer be needed as soon as we're able
  to move to ansible 2.5 which improves the UX when the block/rescue
  pattern is used.

With this change a user will see an "EXIT NOTICE" which is reported in a
way that resembles how ansible reports information on a playbook run
which should be simple to see and understand in almost all cases.

Change-Id: Ic54a7524c09a170e20830c5f8d2c2a0658159ed0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit f0d8ffd5c147fe07335b55ee0f04785a22871e5c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 08:58:40.000000000', 'message': 'Support to query volume filter by changes since/before

Support users can query resources by specifying the time
that resources are changed since or before, and cinder will
return the all which matches condition.

Add two filters changes-since and changes-before in querying API.
"volumes/detail?changes-since=2016-01-01T01:00:00&changes-before=2016-12-31T01:00:00"

NOTE: Now some project have supported this funcation, after finding out
what term they're using, here is the result:

changes-since: nova, glance(for api v2, it's only mentioned in spec)
changed-since: neutron

So for keeping consistent with most of projects, Cinder considers to
use changes-since and changes-before too.

Change-Id: I56b8ea6178586c0aad5516e14da33eb927488910
Partial-Implements: blueprint support-to-query-cinder-resources-filter-by-change-since
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support to query volume filter by changes since/before

Support users can query resources by specifying the time
that resources are changed since or before, and cinder will
return the all which matches condition.

Add two filters changes-since and changes-before in querying API.
"volumes/detail?changes-since=2016-01-01T01:00:00&changes-before=2016-12-31T01:00:00"

NOTE: Now some project have supported this funcation, after finding out
what term they're using, here is the result:

changes-since: nova, glance(for api v2, it's only mentioned in spec)
changed-since: neutron

So for keeping consistent with most of projects, Cinder considers to
use changes-since and changes-before too.

Change-Id: I56b8ea6178586c0aad5516e14da33eb927488910
Partial-Implements: blueprint support-to-query-cinder-resources-filter-by-change-since
Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 10:11:07.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=1.12.0

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC",
but on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: I426cf42ddcf6e8aa2d43f286eb76908670cc8d16
Closes-bug: #1744160

commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct
date handling, but when converting this value there is a slight
difference where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC",
but on python 3 they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match
on "UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: I426cf42ddcf6e8aa2d43f286eb76908670cc8d16
Closes-bug: #1744160

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

[{'created': '2018-01-25 16:27:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix creating release notes using tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>

Commit 173b11cb50e115fe12baa097a05db36f24f2e181 moved the reno
dependency from test-requirements to doc/requirements which weren't
used by the venv tox target, which means you can't create release
notes the easy way "tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>". This fixes it
by adding the doc/requirements into the venv target.

Change-Id: Ic3724435176eab6f7fcc53cf5379f7eee44baa71
'}]
commit_message:
Fix creating release notes using tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>

Commit 173b11cb50e115fe12baa097a05db36f24f2e181 moved the reno
dependency from test-requirements to doc/requirements which weren't
used by the venv tox target, which means you can't create release
notes the easy way "tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>". This fixes it
by adding the doc/requirements into the venv target.

commit_message:
Avoid suspending guest with attached vGPUs

Since libvirt doesn't allow us to hot-unplug mediated devices, we need to
short-circuit the suspend action if the instance has mediated devices
and set it back to the ACTIVE state.

Change-Id: I01147bb3c66d94fdecb76395e5205767a905d18a

[{'created': '2017-12-08 00:36:53.000000000', 'message': "[placement] Add sending global request ID in delete (3)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header in the request of DELETE.
When deleteing resource provider inventories, the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I1dac3d340fe7077095d68f803cf5335ffd5b3364

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in delete (3)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header in the request of DELETE.
When deleteing resource provider inventories, the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I1dac3d340fe7077095d68f803cf5335ffd5b3364
Partial-Bug: #1734625

for some reason I think the autocreate account prefix is configurable [1]

I'd be ok in allowing internal accounts being entirely exempt from the length checking?  maybe double is fine?  or a super hard limit of 4k or 8k or something and then making sure that we set some restrictions on how long operators can open up the client length limits?

"double it" isn't obviously correct to me.  But not nessicarily incorrect either - the point is we want them to be:

1) longer than operator configured limit
2) .. such that we don't have to freakout about doing something that should be reasonable
3) not so long that it's broken/dangerous/insecure-on-accident for different reasons

1. https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/etc/proxy-server.conf-sample#L165'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2017-06-26 11:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is cool, 2* would be enough for sharding (account name and container names) so from my POV great :)

We should problably only define the *2 in one place. Maybe something like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/613705/'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-13 19:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-13 19:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Clay: Good call -- fixed to respect auto_create_account_prefix. Doubling was a pretty arbitrary choice -- I wanted there to be *some* limit, and for it to be noticeably larger than the typical-external-client limit.

Matt: Nice -- I like having it centralized like that. Then if we *do* want to remove the restriction entirely or make the multiplier configurable or set some arbitrarily "large" limit, we've got the one place to change it.

At some point, we'll probably also want to have something like this for objects (hi, versioned_writes!) but when I looked at it originally, that seemed like a lot more work...'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-10-13 19:46:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-13 21:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

I like it, nice one Tim. Doubling things is good enough, if we decide it's too high at least we only need to change one method. Likewise if for some strange reason we need more.

PLUS.. This cleans up the sharding account and container length edge case problem. So a big win in my book :)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-30 00:22:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Seems like a good-enough solution. Doubling might not be exactly right, but it should be sufficient for all our existing code and it's simple enough for even me to think about. :)"}]

commit_message:
Increase name-length limits for internal accounts

Double account and container name-length limits for accounts starting with
auto_create_account_prefix (default: '.') -- these are used internally by
Swift, and may need to have some prefix followed by a user-settable value.

Related-Change: Ice703dc6d98108ad251c43f824426d026e1f1d97
Change-Id: Ie1ce5ea49b06ab3002c0bd0fad7cea16cea2598e

commit_message:
New template: Example for Cinder volumes batch creation

Add an example serving as documentation.
It is not meant to be used as is, though it works.
This is a template to create volumes which the numbers you can specify.

Change-Id: Ifa49d2f9937c1f07652d4a73ea7544cb1e476524

commit_message:
New template: Example for Nova Instance

Add an example serving as documentation.It is not meant to be used as is, though it works.
This is a template to create a new instance and a new volume, then attaching the volume to the instance.

Change-Id: I1e1f0b3a5bf9ed9fcb56333a0bae9e00db8a05a5

subject: DNM/WIP: Convert using str() so types stay consistent
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 18:59:54.000000000', 'message': "DNM/WIP: Convert using str() so types stay consistent

Previously we were using six.text_type() to convert to a string
representation. This is fine in Python 3 as the type of the string
doesn't change. But in Python 2 it goes from a 'str' type to a
'unicode' type which is not needed for these two cases.

This will make adding of type-hints in the future easier as the types
will stay consistent.

Change-Id: Iea7b67da8c208674d1c5a9d4617bfadb9847d9dd
"}]
commit_message:
DNM/WIP: Convert using str() so types stay consistent

Previously we were using six.text_type() to convert to a string
representation. This is fine in Python 3 as the type of the string
doesn't change. But in Python 2 it goes from a 'str' type to a
'unicode' type which is not needed for these two cases.

This will make adding of type-hints in the future easier as the types
will stay consistent.

Change-Id: Iea7b67da8c208674d1c5a9d4617bfadb9847d9dd

commit_message:
Alertmanager: Use volumeclaimtemplate for storage

This removes the pvc in Alertmanager and changes the default
storage_class to readwriteonce.  Now that Alertmanager uses peer
meshing, it's not required for the replicas to share a common
volume claim

Change-Id: I24290264cb0e552a143a56faa753289f073c47b9

commit_message:
Add documentation for node traits

Updates the install and admin guides with information on node traits.

Support for node traits was added in Bare Metal REST API version 1.37.

Change-Id: I86e86320df4eb81aa30e5708dde9c82f50ba4d50
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532288/
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Always set ignoreskipactivation on snapshot creation

There seem to be different defaults in distros so we
enforce the flag to be set.

Change-Id: Ia166ee66e9983a54241e8b609202f58569552fab

subject: Fix serialization of choices and reenable congress-agent.
messages:
[{'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-12 17:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-12 20:16:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It is not clear why the ha test fails: timeout waiting for replica ?

2018-01-12 17:59:58.025 11391 WARNING urllib3.connectionpool [-] Retrying (Retry(total=9, connect=None, read=None, redirect=5, status=None)) after connection broken by 'NewConnectionError('<urllib3.connection.HTTPConnection object at 0x7f296371eb00>: Failed to establish a new connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused',)': /v1/policies

Will try a recheck to see if the problem is stable."}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-12 20:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-15 03:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-15 10:13:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thanks Pierre. Looks good. Could you please update the documentation on the availability of this variable while using devstack, that would help'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-15 13:49:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-15 13:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2018-01-16 04:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-16 05:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 05:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 07:29:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-24 13:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Congress Tempest tests are failing too often randomly with cfg validator datasource activated. The point is that a new datasource with data coming from the agent HAS an impact on the time taken and most tests rely on timeouts. 

First step is to reduce the poll time of this datasource (every 10 mn seems enough). If this is not enough. It must be disabled by default but not the agent with a new variable ENABLE_CONGRESS_CONFIG_DATASOURCE that would be False by default.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 23:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 23:57:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Seems to be having the same failures.
http://logs.openstack.org/48/533248/5/check/congress-devstack-api-mysql/52350e3/logs/testr_results.html.gz

@Pierre, what are you seeing that leads you to think it's the increased polling and data processing load causing the problems? I get the same failures when I tried setting a very long test timeout, which seems counter to the idea that it's increased load causing the failures. See below:

1000s test timeout, 10s polling interval: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537620/
1000s test timeout, 300s polling interval: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537703/"}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-25 13:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-25 17:11:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-25 17:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

thanks Pierre. 

You might consider temporarily disabling OOO and other jobs in order to get a quicker turn-around from infra, then re-enabling when we know the dsvm tests pass.
Something like this:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537703/1/.zuul.yaml'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-25 17:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Also, I'm having some trouble understanding how a race condition can cause the failures we see in the test where the test time out is set to 1000s and poll time is set to 10s.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537620/1/devstack/plugin.sh
or 300s
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/537703/

In either case, I would've expected a race to eventually be resolved on subsequent tries.

I'm only asking in case it's helpful. No need to explain/discuss this right now if it's not helpful =)"}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-25 22:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

the datasource is a polling driver but the poll just broadcast a request for templates. tablles are filled later asychronously. an early query will find no table and crash unless the driver initialize it for the first poll. if the driver starts before the agent. the first poll is missed and we have to wait 10 minutes. tempest does not... so the agent sends always templates when it starts. This works well only if the sending is a cast not a call.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-26 03:31:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Pierre, got it thanks for the explanation.

A couple comments:
1. Great that makes sense to initialize tables so that a race does not cause a crash.
2. On the issue to having to wait 10 minutes until the next poll, I think we may not need to work too hard to avoid it. Instead, we can just configure it so that the polling is more frequent (say 10s or 30s) and the tempest test waits long enough for at least 2-3 polls. If we don't want the standard devstack install to make polling frequent on this data source (because the data is mostly static), we can can set a special variable to make the polling more frequent in tempest testing but less frequent (say 10mn) in normal install.
3. You can mostly ignore the failures in congress_tempest_tests.tests.scenario.congress_ha.test_ha.TestHA
and
congress_tempest_tests.tests.scenario.test_congress_basic_ops.TestPolicyLibraryBasicOps
We've seen some instability in those tests independently from the config validator, and we'll work on stabilizing them."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-26 03:33:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

one last thing, I think it's unlikely the config validator polling at 10s is causing those failures in
congress_tempest_tests.tests.scenario.congress_ha.test_ha.TestHA
and
congress_tempest_tests.tests.scenario.test_congress_basic_ops.TestPolicyLibraryBasicOps

But if you have reason to believe it I'd love to hear why!"}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-26 08:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-26 10:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-26 13:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

So the root cause of the bug was deterministic: the option chosen for the metadata_check was deprecated and recently removed from congress... The change has been propagated to the new congress_tempest_plugin in a separate commit.

This does not explain some of the transient check we had. I reverted all the changes on the agent and changing the poll frequency.This will be addressed in another change. I keep the initialization of tables because i think it fix most race problems.

I do a recheck to ensure that the result on the gate is stable.'}, {'account_id': 23518, 'date': '2018-01-26 13:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-26 19:37:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

Ahh. Glad you found the problem. That was tricky. Sorry we didn't catch the dependency on that config option.

commit_message:
Fix serialization of choices and reenable congress-agent.

oslo_config uses OrderedDict for choices in
options types. This serialize it as list of tuples.
Order is  preserved and types are naturally
deserialized back from those tuples.

Congress-agent is reenabled. It can be disabled
in devstack on  the value of ENABLE_CONGRESS_AGENT
(default is True).

Driver will initialize table to empty at first poll not
waiting for an initial response from agents.

Closes-Bug: #1742833
Change-Id: If1423e824fc457bab89f4bcd12be8826c50f5f69

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 23:08:23.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Reduce stestr concurrency

Stestr runs parallel processes based on the number of CPUs on the
machine[1]. In CI we typically have 8 CPUs. It's possible that the
number of workers is creating too many simultaneous MySQL connections
and causing our unit tests to fail sometimes[2][3]. Try reducing the
concurrency to see if we can give the MySQL server a rest.

If we decide to keep this it should go into a zuul job definition and
not directly in the tox config.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/blob/28cb7f23815e68037dc4efc014ad12808ee7315f/doc/source/MANUAL.rst#parallel-testing
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/43/536543/9/check/openstack-tox-py35/0729ea7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-30_19_36_38_136523
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/23/524423/44/gate/openstack-tox-py35/0f8083f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_21_11_52_855308

Change-Id: I49b9073ab7e487942340ed01c060e2ebf6608246
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: Reduce stestr concurrency

Stestr runs parallel processes based on the number of CPUs on the
machine[1]. In CI we typically have 8 CPUs. It's possible that the
number of workers is creating too many simultaneous MySQL connections
and causing our unit tests to fail sometimes[2][3]. Try reducing the
concurrency to see if we can give the MySQL server a rest.

If we decide to keep this it should go into a zuul job definition and
not directly in the tox config.

[1] https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/blob/28cb7f23815e68037dc4efc014ad12808ee7315f/doc/source/MANUAL.rst#parallel-testing
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/43/536543/9/check/openstack-tox-py35/0729ea7/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-30_19_36_38_136523
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/23/524423/44/gate/openstack-tox-py35/0f8083f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-28_21_11_52_855308

Change-Id: I49b9073ab7e487942340ed01c060e2ebf6608246

commit_message:
[placement] Add functional tests for resource class API

Add functional tests for resource class API
in the following cases.

* Additional properties in POST /resource_classes
* Additional properties in PUT /resource_classes/{name} (1.6)
* Earlier microversion (1.1) in the following APIs

  - POST /resource_classes
  - GET /resource_classes/{name}
  - PUT /resource_classes/{name}
  - DELETE /resource_classes/{name}

Change-Id: I7a8b0853c7580d31ab61884b10b80e5f7c8bb0b6

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated "giturl" option

From openstackdocstheme 1.18.0, valid Git URLs can be retrieved by
openstackdocstheme[1], we do not need giturl option anymore.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/532163

Change-Id: I579cebae6486d250915f936f0c1c61008471c089

commit_message:
Merge server create for availability zone extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for AZ extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-queens

Change-Id: I4d817e5516c8bea8f3bffb28683a1e041303dae9

commit_message:
Merge server create schema for availability zone extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the schema part of create server for AZ extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-queens
Change-Id: I3671e63187b79cb7a80594d4d7a948565a9003bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 10:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Fix parameter type in server-migrations.inc

When the parameter is always 'null', it should be defined as 'none'.
So fix the parameter type of the 'force_complete'
in "Force Migration Complete Action" API.

And add an additional description for the action.

Change-Id: Ic0dd390a87d0d5a88d9a08fdaa9e59ee99f6e7c4
Closes-Bug: #1744688
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Fix parameter type in server-migrations.inc

When the parameter is always 'null', it should be defined as 'none'.
So fix the parameter type of the 'force_complete'
in "Force Migration Complete Action" API.

And add an additional description for the action.

Change-Id: Ic0dd390a87d0d5a88d9a08fdaa9e59ee99f6e7c4
Closes-Bug: #1744688

commit_message:
Add debug output for selected page size

Adds debug output for selected page size when hw:mem_page_size
is specified. This output is especially useful in the case of
hw:mem_page_size=any.

Change-Id: Ie43228dbfa5623f880e9be032d8ebd9d0be42870
Closes-Bug: #1740795

commit_message:
Cleanup redundant want_version assignment.

This redundant line was added in [1], but we already introduced the
want_version in line [2].

This patch remove the redundant line[2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521640/10/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_provider.py@321
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/521640/10/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/resource_provider.py@328

trivial_fix

Change-Id: Ie008775384f8103214e21b39f3273f48f699fb65

[{'created': '2018-01-25 17:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Fix MariaDB development package

The galera_client commit-id Ib270b0fe23de76620491247efc3352fbc6c1e9b5
switched to the upstream MariaDB packages instead of the ones from the
OBS so we need to update the development package in the SUSE variables
file.

'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Fix MariaDB development package

The galera_client commit-id Ib270b0fe23de76620491247efc3352fbc6c1e9b5
switched to the upstream MariaDB packages instead of the ones from the
OBS so we need to update the development package in the SUSE variables
file.

Change-Id: I15f993a3f80283f772bbb8ad75311f5117ff7ac0

TestCfgValidatorDriver.test_metadata_sent used
datasource_file, a deprecated option that was removed.
Use datasource_sync_period instead.

subject: Revert "Temporarily remove ansible/ansible from pipelines"
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-30 18:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 18:34:54.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Temporarily remove ansible/ansible from pipelines"

Add ansible/ansible to the third-party-check pipeline. This should allow
us to run tests but not to report the spammy merge failure errors.

This reverts commit b7c0a786ac1178c10d232408c1a0a287c73e83d3.

Change-Id: I30a11d82b5c78a4e257602dd33df7df58566a251
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily remove ansible/ansible from pipelines"

Add ansible/ansible to the third-party-check pipeline. This should allow
us to run tests but not to report the spammy merge failure errors.

This reverts commit b7c0a786ac1178c10d232408c1a0a287c73e83d3.

Change-Id: I30a11d82b5c78a4e257602dd33df7df58566a251

subject: Add third-party-check pipeline
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-30 18:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 18:34:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add third-party-check pipeline

Currently merge failure reporting is pipeline global. That means we wind
up reporting  merge failures on ALL changes to third-party github
repos, even if the change is touching files we would not otherwise
normally test.

Add a new pipeline for external projects that does not report merge
failures.

Change-Id: I5a65cf9babdf37b385e321f350752124c3e1de1e
'}]
commit_message:
Add third-party-check pipeline

Currently merge failure reporting is pipeline global. That means we wind
up reporting  merge failures on ALL changes to third-party github
repos, even if the change is touching files we would not otherwise
normally test.

Add a new pipeline for external projects that does not report merge
failures.

Change-Id: I5a65cf9babdf37b385e321f350752124c3e1de1e

commit_message:
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT expects boolean

Previously the single domain mode has been implemented. This is a
follow-up commit to set the value properly as boolean instead of string.

Change-Id: I0e34d93d05693bf0ca5e8f68bc9af198fd29680a
Closes-Bug: #1744346
Related-Bug: #1712999

The validation error

  deliverables/queens/blazar-nova.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/blazar-nova, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'check-requirements', 'openstack-python-jobs', 'openstack-python35-jobs-nonvoting', 'release-openstack-server'] or no release will be published

means that the release job in project-config and release-type in this repository do not match.

Is blazar-nova a plugin for nova, or a completely separate python service with its own REST API endpoint?"}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:49:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This repo is an plugin for nova, a nova scheduler filter. I added release-type: python-pypi in it.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-29 22:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

The release job for this one is also incorrect

  deliverables/queens/blazar-nova.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/blazar-nova, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'check-requirements', 'openstack-python-jobs', 'openstack-python35-jobs-nonvoting', 'release-openstack-server'] or no release will be published

The settings in the project-config repository need to be changed to use publish-to-pypi instead of release-openstack-server."}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-30 02:04:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thanks Doug. I've already pushed a patch for updating the releasejob to publish-pypi instead of openstack-server-release[1] and added it as Depends-On path.

commit_message:
unbreak tempest tests

The initialization of the self.networks variable was missing.

I don't know yet why this wasn't showing up before, possibly
because the tempest test suite was not in CI before (?).

Change-Id: I3942724a2ce15aa825c956e521f3f4c0af9b8916

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie8c48c2c8dc1ab1ae898bd9bb7ab57317768d844

messages:

I reported this was missing in stable/pike to cloudnull in IRC. I've cherry picked this change to my local copy of stable/pike and it resolved the issue. It skipped the new init.scope check for my CentOS 7 setup.

#### BEFORE PATCH ####
TASK [lxc_hosts : Get init.scope pids.max value] ***********************************************************************
Monday 29 January 2018  15:31:45 -0600 (0:00:01.233)       0:11:12.481 ******** 
fatal: [hc1]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "file not found: /sys/fs/cgroup/pids/init.scope/pids.max"}

#### AFTER PATCH ####
TASK [lxc_hosts : Check that the init.scope support the pid controller] ************************************************
Tuesday 30 January 2018  08:20:58 -0600 (0:00:01.109)       0:11:22.481 ******* 
ok: [hc1]

TASK [lxc_hosts : Get init.scope pids.max value] ***********************************************************************
Tuesday 30 January 2018  08:20:59 -0600 (0:00:01.064)       0:11:23.546 ******* 
skipping: [hc1]

TASK [lxc_hosts : Set systemd pids.max in init.scope] ******************************************************************

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 22:07:04.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: lxc_post_install: Handle missing init.scope scope

The init.scope was added in systemd-v226 and support for the pid
controller was added in systemd-v227. However, stable distributions may
be on older systemd version so we need to check whether the scope exists
before we try to adjust the maximum number of processes for that scope.

Change-Id: Ic38e17d110e7a72770286c2faf571ba03bde7f32
Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/efdb02375beb0a940c3320865572913780b4d7de
Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/03a7b521e3ffb7f5d153d90480ba5d4bc29d1e8f
Closes-Bug: #1743382
(cherry picked from commit 165bd142b1d40467284f6b13457888b599b2bebd)
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: lxc_post_install: Handle missing init.scope scope

The init.scope was added in systemd-v226 and support for the pid
controller was added in systemd-v227. However, stable distributions may
be on older systemd version so we need to check whether the scope exists
before we try to adjust the maximum number of processes for that scope.

Change-Id: Ic38e17d110e7a72770286c2faf571ba03bde7f32
Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/efdb02375beb0a940c3320865572913780b4d7de
Link: https://github.com/systemd/systemd/commit/03a7b521e3ffb7f5d153d90480ba5d4bc29d1e8f
Closes-Bug: #1743382
(cherry picked from commit 165bd142b1d40467284f6b13457888b599b2bebd)

Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Fix a comment in a notification functional test

In NotificationSampleTestBase class,
a compute service is started by the following statement.

self.compute = self.start_service('compute')

In this case, the host name is 'compute'.
So fix a comment in the test_live_migration_actions method
of TestInstanceNotificationSampleWithMultipleCompute class.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: Id3a5c0fd80d272b763350731b77db01ab98ea94b

commit_message:
Make sure that functional test triggered on sample changes

To be able to define different irrelevant-files for the functional jobs
than the ones defined in openstack-zuul-jobs we need to copy the jobs to
the nova tree and modify the fields in tree.

Technically we could factor out the irrelevant-files regexp list from
functional and functional-py35 jobs as they are the same today. However
in the future when they diverge we cannot simply override the
irrelevant-files in one of the jobs. Therefore this patch does not
introduce a common base job for functinal and functional-py35 jobs
to discurage trying to override.

The openstack-tox-functional and fuctional-py35 are removed from the
nova part of the project-config in
I56d44f8dff41dbf3b2ff2382fa39b364f55f9a44

Conflicts:
      .zuul.yaml

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due ot the nova-lvm job definition
not existing in Pike, which is OK because it's a non-voting job
that runs in the experimental queue so we don't need it in Pike.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/538619/

Closes-Bug: #1742962
Change-Id: Ia684786d1622da7af31aa4479fc883a7c65848ff
(cherry picked from commit d4377c2d537ea998ed96cc8d7071877eefab994f)

commit_message:
Fix nits found in node traits

Includes:

* Return a location in HTTP response header for PUT
  /nodes/<node>/traits/<trait>.
* Correct order of arguments to assertEqual() in conductor manager unit
  tests for traits.
* Use () rather than \ for multiline formatting.
* Set tags and traits fields on NodeModel to default of [] in DB node
  create after DB insert.

Change-Id: Ia88f7ca69b777b82caca2871e44edab39f2a8310
Partial-Bug: #1722194

subject: Release blazar-dashboard 1.0.0 for Queens
messages:
[{'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-26 08:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-26 08:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-28 16:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There are two validation issues

  deliverables/queens/blazar-dashboard.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/blazar-dashboard, one of ['publish-to-pypi-horizon'] needs to be included in ['system-required', 'openstack-python-jobs-horizon', 'check-requirements', 'openstack-python35-jobs-nonvoting', 'release-notes-jobs', 'release-openstack-server'] or no release will be published

This is caused by the release job validation not being able to tell that this project is a horizon dashboard plugin and can be fixed by setting the release-type to "horizon". See README.rst for details.

  deliverables/queens/blazar-dashboard.yaml: could not validate version '1.0.0.0b3': Version 1.0.0.0b3 looks like a pre-release and the release model does not allow for it

This is caused by the release-model being set to cycle-with-intermediary and can be fixed by choosing a version number without the 0b3 suffix. Either 1.0.0 or 0.4.0 would be appropriate.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-29 22:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-30 00:05:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> There are two validation issues
 > 
 > deliverables/queens/blazar-dashboard.yaml: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml
 > no release job specified for openstack/blazar-dashboard, one of
 > ['publish-to-pypi-horizon'] needs to be included in
 > ['system-required', 'openstack-python-jobs-horizon',
 > 'check-requirements', 'openstack-python35-jobs-nonvoting',
 > 'release-notes-jobs', 'release-openstack-server'] or no release
 > will be published
 > 
 > This is caused by the release job validation not being able to tell
 > that this project is a horizon dashboard plugin and can be fixed by
 > setting the release-type to "horizon". See README.rst for details.

I'm sorry, I misinterpreted that error.

The validation job did correctly detect that the repo is a horizon plugin, and the repo is configured to use the wrong release job in project-config. It needs to be updated to use publish-to-pypi-horizon instead of release-openstack-server.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-01-30 02:02:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fix keepalived warnings

Relative paths for keepalived scripts cause warnings to appear in
the systemd journal:

    Unable to access script `kill`
    Disabling track script haproxy_check_script since not found
    WARNING - script `ping` resolved by path search to
      `/usr/bin/ping`. Please specify full path.

This patch ensures that full paths are used for both of the current
keepalived scripts and it removes the warnings from the logs.

It also ensures that script security is enabled. This prevents
keepalived from running a script as root that a normal user can
write to.

Closes-Bug: 1742487
Change-Id: Ie3bc334a1669c976298d7ef1eb7361e85fade7e1

messages:
[{'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-28 10:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-28 15:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-28 22:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the cleanup.

One question: how did you check unused parameters in parameters.yaml? If you have some tool to check it, it would be useful.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-29 07:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I just used some bash one-liner with for loop and grep. I can paste it here later if You want :)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-29 07:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27546, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-29 20:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-30 17:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Great thanks!


I'd almost like to see the api-ref build fail if params are defined that aren't used.. Or at least some tox target we could run manually occasionally."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-01-30 17:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Thanks for the cleanup.
 > 
 > One question: how did you check unused parameters in
 > parameters.yaml? If you have some tool to check it, it would be
 > useful.

So I found all such unused parameters with one liner like:

for var in $(egrep -v "^ " parameters.yaml | cut -d ":" -f 1); do egrep -q "$var" *.inc; if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo $var; fi; done'}]

commit_message:
[Api-ref] Cleanup parameters.yaml

This commit:
* removes all params defined in parameters.yaml which are
  not used in any .inc file,
* rename "type_2" param to "vpn_endpoint_type" as it is easier to
  understand what it is,
* remove "tenant_id" and "tenant_id-request" params and replace them
  with "project_id-body-optional" and "project_id-request" as both were
  the same

Change-Id: I6acfc28514e3201b6035a6bbfedc08ec8e389899
Closes-Bug: #1745380

commit_message:
Remove unused gitdb dependency

Newer versions of gitdb are conflicting with the dependencies of newer
versions of GitPython, so they can not be properly coinstalled

This dep was introduced in If069ebb33ee4cb7f81308c68849ba9f969752d25
but not actually used back then. drop it.

Change-Id: Idc30b635dcba04aec47a3537cb9cc490eb255da9

commit_message:
Set server status to ERROR if rebuild failed

Currently there is no indication that the rebuild was refused,
and worse, we may have a wrong imageref for the instance.

This patch set the instance to ERROR status if rebuild failed in the
scheduling stage. The user can rebuild the instance with valid image
to get it out of ERROR state and reset with right instance metadata and
properties.

Closes-Bug: 1744325

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was because the select_destinations method
has additional parameters in Queens that don't exist in Pike.

Change-Id: Ibb7bee15a3d4ee6f0ef53ba12e8b41f65a1fe999
(cherry picked from commit d03a890a34f632adc9a19a33c8a5aebbccec50e4)

commit_message:
tempest test improvements

There frequent failure of the test_bgpvpn_port_association_create_and_delete
and test_bgpvpn_port_association_create_and_update tests, where the
destination loopback IP seems to remains reachable even after
association or route is removed.

This change modifies the tests to:
- add more information when this happens (try to identify the server
  answering the ping)
- do an initial check that the destination loopback IP is not reachable
  before the tests starts
- correct a misleading message

Change-Id: Iaba153bf01b2a47ebca7d7d6804981f5a77c7142

commit_message:
bagpipe: advertise support for VNI extension

bagpipe driver introduces support for the VNI extension
in I98d36903bc0e44f31531e03226c6b60e9fc88618, we can hence
advertise the support for the API extension.

Change-Id: I72dba91de9db9262614dda917842fb98690c074b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I1d3d92ee5962f0a292718409a5b0cd884a4d4e6d

What's the change that breaks backwards compat and why is it so necessary?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-16 05:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In which use case is this happening? Within the ci? Why is constraints then not used? Or is this about end user install?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-11-16 14:07:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The change is an merging with os-client-config and a removal of the pieces of SDK that duplicate os-client-config and keystoneauth functionality.

Constraints will keep the gate fine. The concern I have is end-user installs, specifically people having installed python-openstackclient from pip. I don't want those people to accidentally have their stable python-openstackclient broken by a new release of openstacksdk.

We want to do this now because sdk is still an 0.x but we'd like to release a supportable 1.x soon - hopefully this cycle. I don't want to carry deprecated/old API things into the 1.0, because like shade, once sdk releases a 1.0 we'll consider the API to be very very locked."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2017-12-14 01:31:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Arriving late to the party.

I have a question about what will happen on master which IMO impacts if this is acceptable.

Assuming we merge this we'll need to do the same on previous releases"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-01-30 19:45:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

abandoning, reopen if it's still valid (but I think we've moved on...)"}]

commit_message:
Cap openstacksdk for stable releases

A breaking API change is coming to python-openstacksdk that we do not
want to hit things from our stable releases. We'll get things updated
properly during queens, so only need the cap for old projects.

Change-Id: I7fdc67f9ac0aeb20fd8779b3f4c22f43b865f74a

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I325ed6b633e3d52da7139e5e7c71d609b25479eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 21:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the
  evacuation

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Closes-Bug: #1739013

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from methods in Queens that don't exist
in Pike.

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
(cherry picked from commit ec040527368a13cdc5ed427b21692be5bb2f28b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix false positive server group functional tests

Most of the evacuate tests in nova.tests.functional.test_server_group
could produce false positive results becuase of multiple reasons:
* test did not wait for the migration to finish in done or error state
  before checked the instance host
* test did not asserted that the instance host is changed during the
  evacuation

Also the evacuation tests that starts up a third compute failed to add
the magic fake.set_nodes() call making the third node unusable and
causing unexpected NoValidHost during the evacuation. However it was
not visible until the above mistakes are fixed in the test

Closes-Bug: #1739013

 Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict was from methods in Queens that don't exist
in Pike.

Change-Id: Idc4e3d8ac7c99c09c6f4860dc0c7a05f28a35627
(cherry picked from commit ec040527368a13cdc5ed427b21692be5bb2f28b6)

commit_message:
Point heat.conf[clients_keystone/auth_uri] to the public endpoint.

It used to have the internal one which makes it impossible for clients
in an instance to auth against the heat server.  For instance using
os-collect-config inside a vm against the heat-server of
the (over)cloud.

Seen on RDO cloud using Traas.

Depends-On: I4429d86d831f49f1bc0fef04379a81ada20b6ab6

Change-Id: Ib1cb8a5da886e3f7afd88f8dc9d63f0847f677bd

commit_message:
Collapse duplicate error handling in rebuild_instance

The exception blocks in here are doing the same thing except
for request_spec.to_legacy_request_spec_dict() which is not
necessary since set_vm_state_and_notify() handles a RequestSpec
object.

Change-Id: Ifdc6f0e9e722496768b1ad4b6b3590eb29fc53b8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 16:10:15.000000000', 'message': "Rollback instance.image_ref on failed rebuild

When rebuilding and changing the image, we run the new image
through the scheduler to see if it's valid for the instance
on it's current compute host. The API saves off the new image
ref on the instance before casting to conductor to run through
the scheduler. If the scheduler fails, the instance.image_ref was
not being rolled back, which meant a user could attempt the rebuild
with the same invalid image a second time and the API, seeing the
instance.image_ref hasn't changed (even though it's not the actual
backing image for the server), will bypass the scheduler and rebuild
the instance with that invalid image.

This fixes the issue by using the original image ref, passed from
API to conductor during rebuild, to reset the instance.image_ref
in the case of a failure.

The related functional test is updated to show this fixes the bug.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1539703

Change-Id: I3399a66fe9b1297cd6b0dca440145393ceaef41f
"}, {'created': '2018-01-29 16:32:31.000000000', 'message': "Rollback instance.image_ref on failed rebuild

When rebuilding and changing the image, we run the new image
through the scheduler to see if it's valid for the instance
on it's current compute host. The API saves off the new image
ref on the instance before casting to conductor to run through
the scheduler. If the scheduler fails, the instance.image_ref was
not being rolled back, which meant a user could attempt the rebuild
with the same invalid image a second time and the API, seeing the
instance.image_ref hasn't changed (even though it's not the actual
backing image for the server), will bypass the scheduler and rebuild
the instance with that invalid image.

This fixes the issue by using the original image ref, passed from
API to conductor during rebuild, to reset the instance.image_ref
in the case of a failure.

Note that there are other things changed on the instance in the API
which this patch does not attempt to recover as that's a bigger
work item which likely involves substantial refactoring of the code.

Closes-Bug: #1746032

Change-Id: I3399a66fe9b1297cd6b0dca440145393ceaef41f
"}, {'created': '2018-01-29 16:47:27.000000000', 'message': "Rollback instance.image_ref on failed rebuild

commit_message:
Rollback instance.image_ref on failed rebuild

When rebuilding and changing the image, we run the new image
through the scheduler to see if it's valid for the instance
on its current compute host. The API saves off the new image
ref on the instance before casting to conductor to run through
the scheduler. If the scheduler fails, the instance.image_ref was
not being rolled back, which meant a user could attempt the rebuild
with the same invalid image a second time and the API, seeing the
instance.image_ref hasn't changed (even though it's not the actual
backing image for the server), will bypass the scheduler and rebuild
the instance with that invalid image.

This fixes the issue by using the original image ref, passed from
API to conductor during rebuild, to reset the instance.image_ref
in the case of a failure.

Note that there are other things changed on the instance in the API
which this patch does not attempt to recover as that's a bigger
work item which likely involves substantial refactoring of the code.

Closes-Bug: #1746032

Change-Id: I3399a66fe9b1297cd6b0dca440145393ceaef41f

commit_message:
Bumping functional test job timeouts

Recently we saw frequent job timeouts probably due to the intel kernel
patches. So this patch bumps the functional and functional-py35 jobs
timeout from 1800 seconds to 3600 seconds.

Change-Id: I632e006e1ba62c998955a04421e0e0c6311544cb
Closes-Bug: #1745398

Code used to pass raw sessions to Resource methods. A common way to do
that was to do thins like FloatingIP.get(conn.session, name_or_id). As
conn.session is a session.Session that doesn't work anymore.

commit_message:
Provide compatibility for people passing raw sessions

Code used to pass raw sessions to Resource methods. A common way to do
that was to do thins like FloatingIP.get(conn.session, name_or_id). As
conn.session is a session.Session that doesn't work anymore.

To help ease upgrade path issues, attach a reference to the Connection
into conn.session and so that we can pull the right adapter for a given
resource back out.

Add the neutron-grenade job to verify this works.

Change-Id: Ief9a0215ea2399b91d1d03a8048e73e6d7bedd64

commit_message:
Use reporting_interval option from neutron

Instead of hard-coding the agent reporting interval
use the reporting_interval option.

Also add some logging at INFO and DEBUG level.

Related-Bug: #1658964
Change-Id: I95dde46571ccb096c15007973e86dc763693f68f

commit_message:
Update location of undercloud configuration wizard

We now have more formal hosting for this under an OpenShift employee
account so we can set up a proper DNS entry for it.  This change
updates the documentation to reflect the new address.

Change-Id: Id68f3d519522b041a7fea5a643a9f961786e1006

subject: Ensure idl.run() called on TRY_AGAIN
messages: [{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-01-29 15:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-01-29 17:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2018-01-30 16:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-01-30 18:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 15:11:34.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure idl.run() called on TRY_AGAIN

If the DB connection drops after Connection.run() calls idl.run()
but before Transaction.do_commit(), then it is possible for
idl.commit() to return TRY_AGAIN due to the failure of session.send().
This prevents commit_block() from running idl.run() which would
actually trigger the DB reconnect, causing each successive call to
commit_block() to fail in the same way until we stop trying again
due to timeout and Connection.run() calls idl.run() again.

For now, we can just ensure that idl.run() is called when we get a
TRY_AGAIN. It might be worth it to refactor this a bit to not even
use commit_block().

Change-Id: I77402bde3fc4d45c770b9f48882870cfc91d719d
Closes-Bug: #1741889
(cherry picked from commit 1810faecc9ad2345f3e2f9185ac64194c5a0d711)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure idl.run() called on TRY_AGAIN

If the DB connection drops after Connection.run() calls idl.run()
but before Transaction.do_commit(), then it is possible for
idl.commit() to return TRY_AGAIN due to the failure of session.send().
This prevents commit_block() from running idl.run() which would
actually trigger the DB reconnect, causing each successive call to
commit_block() to fail in the same way until we stop trying again
due to timeout and Connection.run() calls idl.run() again.

For now, we can just ensure that idl.run() is called when we get a
TRY_AGAIN. It might be worth it to refactor this a bit to not even
use commit_block().

Change-Id: I77402bde3fc4d45c770b9f48882870cfc91d719d
Closes-Bug: #1741889
(cherry picked from commit 1810faecc9ad2345f3e2f9185ac64194c5a0d711)

commit_message:
Ensure idl.run() called on TRY_AGAIN

If the DB connection drops after Connection.run() calls idl.run()
but before Transaction.do_commit(), then it is possible for
idl.commit() to return TRY_AGAIN due to the failure of session.send().
This prevents commit_block() from running idl.run() which would
actually trigger the DB reconnect, causing each successive call to
commit_block() to fail in the same way until we stop trying again
due to timeout and Connection.run() calls idl.run() again.

For now, we can just ensure that idl.run() is called when we get a
TRY_AGAIN. It might be worth it to refactor this a bit to not even
use commit_block().

Change-Id: I77402bde3fc4d45c770b9f48882870cfc91d719d
Closes-Bug: #1741889
(cherry picked from commit 1810faecc9ad2345f3e2f9185ac64194c5a0d711)

commit_message:
Switch from MechanismDriver to SimpleAgentMechanismDriverBase

Integrate the baremetal neutron L2 agent to agent mechanism
driver. The barametal neutron L2 agent populates bridge_mapping
configuration, the agent mechanism driver will get the bridge
mappings from agent_db data and use this to determine if the
segment specified can be bound.

 * Use constants instead of strings in unit tests.
 * Suppress pyroute2 warning to pass the doc build.

Co-Authored-By: Sam Betts <sam@code-smash.net>
Related-Bug: #1658964
Change-Id: I952c7afbef5e80e3fd2a7f32f11bdc522e1ea397

messages: [{'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-01-30 09:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2888, 'date': '2018-01-30 16:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 09:58:17.000000000', 'message': 'routes-control: DB, adjust lazy loading

SQLAlchemy lazy loading needs to be enabled for the
BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute to BGPVPN relationship,
or else we have an OVO issue as follows:

Parent instance <BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute at 0x7f83190682d0> is not bound to
a Session; lazy load operation of attribute 'bgpvpn' cannot proceed

This change also changes the lazy joining mode to "joined"
for the BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute to BGPVPNPortAssociation relation,
which should here be a bit more efficient.

Change-Id: Ic4b5bc16d1326a328176f121b3b5c3e93d707fd5
'}]
commit_message:
routes-control: DB, adjust lazy loading

SQLAlchemy lazy loading needs to be enabled for the
BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute to BGPVPN relationship,
or else we have an OVO issue as follows:

Parent instance <BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute at 0x7f83190682d0> is not bound to
a Session; lazy load operation of attribute 'bgpvpn' cannot proceed

This change also changes the lazy joining mode to "joined"
for the BGPVPNPortAssociationRoute to BGPVPNPortAssociation relation,
which should here be a bit more efficient.

Change-Id: Ic4b5bc16d1326a328176f121b3b5c3e93d707fd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 16:41:31.000000000', 'message': "Temporarily reduce max-servers in rax-dfw

We're seeing an odd rate limiting behavior on our mirror server in
rax-dfw. Ticket 180130-ord-0000697 has been filed with the provider
to investigate, but while that is underway we'll reduce our
max-servers in that region from 140 to 100 to reduce network
bandwidth consumption on it and relieve the resulting packet loss
and package retrieval slowness/timeouts/errors.

Change-Id: I1ab72262bd2f9f725188a2546f92c7f515c762cc
"}]
commit_message:
Temporarily reduce max-servers in rax-dfw

We're seeing an odd rate limiting behavior on our mirror server in
rax-dfw. Ticket 180130-ord-0000697 has been filed with the provider
to investigate, but while that is underway we'll reduce our
max-servers in that region from 140 to 100 to reduce network
bandwidth consumption on it and relieve the resulting packet loss
and package retrieval slowness/timeouts/errors.

Change-Id: I1ab72262bd2f9f725188a2546f92c7f515c762cc

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 20:17:08.000000000', 'message': 'Plethora of changes to add functionality and fix basic issues.

1. Added Weave as a working CNI/SDS for inter pod communication.
Weave is far more secure than Canal and gives the user another
option to test and play with.

2. Updated tools, kubernetes, ansible, jinja2 etc. Latest k8s
added and tested.

3. Clean up (-cc) now cleans up docker images much more effectively.

4. Support for Ocata, Pike and Master (Queens)!

5. Support added for customer images in custom repo.

6. Support added for custom tags.

7. Pike and Master Nova work-arounds.

8. Addition of option to run fluent-bit container which now picks
up the logs from containers and forwards to ELK etc.

9. Lots of code and message format consistency.

10. Removal Pike Docker registry work-around - now works with real
images from dockerhub.

11. Cinder V3 API integration (still dev mode).

Change-Id: I35d3cd6a09425a2a0fd5080e9eb4f4e8bb957b5d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 22:58:56.000000000', 'message': 'Plethora of changes to add functionality and fix basic issues.

1. Added Weave as a working CNI/SDS for inter pod communication.
Weave is far more secure than Canal and gives the user another
option to test and play with.

2. Updated tools, kubernetes, ansible, jinja2 etc. Latest k8s
added and tested.

3. Clean up (-cc) now cleans up docker images much more effectively.

4. Support for Ocata, Pike and Master (Queens)!

5. Support added for customer images in custom repo.

6. Support added for custom tags.

7. Pike and Master Nova work-arounds.

8. Addition of option to run fluent-bit container which now picks
up the logs from containers and forwards to ELK etc.

9. Lots of code and message format consistency.

10. Removal Pike Docker registry work-around - now works with real
images from dockerhub.

11. Cinder V3 API integration (still dev mode).

Change-Id: I35d3cd6a09425a2a0fd5080e9eb4f4e8bb957b5d
'}]
commit_message:
Plethora of changes to add functionality and fix basic issues.

1. Added Weave as a working CNI/SDS for inter pod communication.
Weave is far more secure than Canal and gives the user another
option to test and play with.

2. Updated tools, kubernetes, ansible, jinja2 etc. Latest k8s
added and tested.

3. Clean up (-cc) now cleans up docker images much more effectively.

4. Support for Ocata, Pike and Master (Queens)!

5. Support added for customer images in custom repo.

6. Support added for custom tags.

7. Pike and Master Nova work-arounds.

8. Addition of option to run fluent-bit container which now picks
up the logs from containers and forwards to ELK etc.

9. Lots of code and message format consistency.

10. Removal Pike Docker registry work-around - now works with real
images from dockerhub.

11. Cinder V3 API integration (still dev mode).

Change-Id: I35d3cd6a09425a2a0fd5080e9eb4f4e8bb957b5d

commit_message:
Pass OSC interface through to barbican plugin

python-openstackclient uses OS_INTERFACE or --os-interface to select a
catalog endpoint to work with. The barbican CLI uses BARBICAN_INTERFACE
or --interface, which OSC won't pass through. This is a problem because
the it prevents the user from selecting a non-public endpoint when using
barbican via openstackclient rather than as a standalone CLI. This patch
updates the osc plugin to pass through the interface set by OSC to the
barbican client class.

Change-Id: I1e9890c9e87fb77b272f939bf33914df739aa5be
(cherry picked from commit 4afb43ab0115f42b4fadcbf19ecac81815d481e3)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
kube-state-metrics for kubernetes version 1.8

This PS is kube-state-metrics for kubernetes version 1.8.
Using kube-state-metrics:v1.2.0 image makes kube-state-
metric pod work properly. Also, gives authority to list
endpoints, persistentvolumes, and horizontalpodautoscalers
by adding them to clusterrole.

Change-Id: I705b29c321b0162740744afa8573dc6ae75bcc60

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

commit_message:
fix custom configuration file path

The parameter [] is not None, so when we specified a custom configuration
file(such as '/my/etc/cloudkitty/cloudkitty.conf' not the default
'/etc/cloudkitty/cloudkitty.conf'), it didn't work, the cloudkitty still
load the default configuration file. We need to set the parameter to None.

Change-Id: Id1ac4378cff618d418b9fb92c4b21e6f322d9250
Closes-Bug: #1735966

commit_message:
fix jobs to create a secret can work on upgrade

This PS fixes the jobs falling into a crash loop state
when upgrading charts.

'kubectl create' command cannot overwrite if a secret already
exists. But 'kubectl apply' command can do it.

Change-Id: Idd6eea06892a30e36e51a9b1130fd7cd84ff65cf

commit_message:
Improve user experience by simplifying the guides

We should as much as possible simplify the deploy guide, and
if possible, reduce the amount of duplicate documentation.

I think this spec shows a few areas of improvements we could set
in place to streamline the user experience.

Change-Id: If884c7a56f9bc97a89973ae98840b5783fb88b88

commit_message:
Add a devstack plugin for Kuryr Tempest Plugin

This commit adds a devstack plugin for the kuryr tempest plugin so users
can directly refer that on their local.conf file.

Change-Id: I818fd1760e20e1ece1d96547a55651a0186f79c5

[{'created': '2018-01-23 11:18:47.000000000', 'message': "simplify shrinking

When a donor/acceptor pair are found for shrinking, don't update their
timestamps and namespaces in the root db immediately but wait for the
shrinking shard to send updates back to root. That way the root shard
range table only changes once the donor has replicated to the
acceptor.

Before, the acceptor shard range namespace was expanded in the root
shard range db *before* the donor objects had cleaved to it, so there
was a window of time when a listing would have 'lost' the donor
objects.

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd
"}, {'created': '2018-01-23 11:49:04.000000000', 'message': "simplify shrinking

timestamps and namespaces in the root db immediately but wait for the
shrinking shard to send updates back to root. That way the root shard
range table only changes once the donor has replicated to the
acceptor.

Before, the acceptor shard range namespace was expanded in the root
shard range db *before* the donor objects had cleaved to it, so there
was a window of time when a listing would have 'lost' the donor
objects.

Also, send a single PUT request to donor to both update its shard
ranges and set its Scan-Done sysmeta.

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd

was a window of time when a listing would have 'lost' the donor

Also, send a single PUT request to donor to both update its shard

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd
"}, {'created': '2018-01-24 15:51:43.000000000', 'message': "simplify shrinking

When a donor/acceptor pair are found for shrinking, don't update their
timestamps and namespaces in the root db immediately but wait for the
shrinking shard to send updates back to root. That way the root shard

Before, the acceptor shard range namespace was expanded in the root

Also, send a single PUT request to donor to both update its shard

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd
"}, {'created': '2018-01-24 16:49:52.000000000', 'message': "simplify shrinking

When a donor/acceptor pair are found for shrinking, don't update their
timestamps and namespaces in the root db immediately but wait for the
shrinking shard to send updates back to root. That way the root shard
range table only changes once the donor has replicated to the
acceptor.

Before, the acceptor shard range namespace was expanded in the root
shard range db *before* the donor objects had cleaved to it, so there
was a window of time when a listing would have 'lost' the donor
objects.

Also, send a single PUT request to donor to both update its shard
ranges and set its Scan-Done sysmeta. This requires the container
server accepting sysmeta updates with shard range updates.

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd
"}]
commit_message:
simplify shrinking

When a donor/acceptor pair are found for shrinking, don't update their
timestamps and namespaces in the root db immediately but wait for the
shrinking shard to send updates back to root. That way the root shard
range table only changes once the donor has replicated to the
acceptor.

Before, the acceptor shard range namespace was expanded in the root
shard range db *before* the donor objects had cleaved to it, so there
was a window of time when a listing would have 'lost' the donor
objects.

Also, send a single PUT request to donor to both update its shard
ranges and set its Scan-Done sysmeta. This requires the container
server accepting sysmeta updates with shard range updates.

Change-Id: I3fddaf1f3dd24abfb4f3011d792580719ffc27cd

commit_message:
Add disable floating ip parameter

Fix behaviour of --floating-ip-enabled and add --floating-ip-disabled.
Removed default setting of floating_ip_enabled API call parameter from
the clients (now the API default is used if it's not explicitly set in
the client arguments).

Change-Id: I9e01addaab17a0d37bb2fed10b4672d421bc1e09
Closes-Bug: #1639119

commit_message:
Prometheus: Use volume claims to support RWO storage class

This PS uses volumeClaimTemplates to provide multiple
pvcs and pvs to prometheus statefulset's multiple pods.
This gives ability to provide read-write-many access
backend by a read-write-once storage class.

Change-Id: I53d1b866c0c87f0833941b612d3acfbe5742744f

commit_message:
Switch (back) ubuntu DIB to use AFS mirror in rackspace

In I4bda502f31087bc125bd452a9075e3caaa031c7d we mistakenly removed
this syntax. Add it back, as it protects our images downloading new
packages before AFS mirrors have had a chance to sync them.

Change-Id: Ie6574777049e456f9deb57b3b6fedddb27b9a1ff
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tune prometheus default intervals and block durations

This increases the default scrape and evaluation intervals to match
those of the prometheus service upstream with the aim to reduce
prometheus's resource consumption. It also adds configuration
parameters for the min and max block durations that series can
span

Change-Id: I7f9352413a273fbf680b892ba26e30cf27bae232

subject: Remove unit tests for ML2 Mechanism driver
messages:
[{'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-10 09:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-10 09:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-10 11:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck - temporary zuul problem'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-16 23:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

it's common practice among neutron umbrella to hinerit test_plugin.
So let's get consensus in neutron and address it uniformly."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-16 23:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 26507, 'date': '2018-01-28 19:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7921, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 15:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I1c3860b20c4499dd10dd78b8a86dd03da40da5f2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-10 09:22:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove unit tests for ML2 Mechanism driver

The test cases importing `neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_plugin` and
creating classes with noop operation [1] follow a faulted pattern. The
reasons are twofold:

1. If the mechanism driver is not loaded correctly [2], the tests then
don't test the mechanism driver but still succeed and therefore there is
no indication that there is something wrong with the code.

2. It gives a false sense of reassurance. If the code of those tests is
analyzed it's possible to see that the code itself is mostly centered
around testing the REST endpoint of neutron than actually testing that
the mechanism succeeds on the operation it was supposed to test. As a
result of this, there is marginally added value on having those tests.
To be clear, the hooks for the respective operations are called on the
mechanism driver, but the result of the operation is not asserted.

For more reference please refer to the mailing list conversations that
discuss this issue:

1. https://lists.opendaylight.org/pipermail/neutron-dev/2017-December/001499.html
2. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125466.html

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=class%20.*\(.*TestMl2
[2]: something that was happening in networking-odl and addressed by

"}, {'created': '2018-01-10 09:24:13.000000000', 'message': "Remove unit tests for ML2 Mechanism driver

The test cases importing `neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_plugin` and
creating classes with noop operation [1] follow a faulted pattern. The
reasons are twofold:

1. If the mechanism driver is not loaded correctly [2], the tests then
don't test the mechanism driver but still succeed and therefore there is
no indication that there is something wrong with the code.

2. It gives a false sense of reassurance. If the code of those tests is
analyzed it's possible to see that the code itself is mostly centered
around testing the REST endpoint of neutron than actually testing that
the mechanism succeeds on the operation it was supposed to test. As a
result of this, there is marginally added value on having those tests.
To be clear, the hooks for the respective operations are called on the
mechanism driver, but the result of the operation is not asserted.

For more reference please refer to the mailing list conversations that
discuss this issue:

1. https://lists.opendaylight.org/pipermail/neutron-dev/2017-December/001499.html
2. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125466.html

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=class%20.*\(.*TestMl2
[2]: something that was happening in networking-odl and addressed by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523934

Change-Id: I242a7f69d62f6e3365164cf8d104a5cf0a8499b0

To be clear, the hooks for the respective operations are called on the

For more reference please refer to the mailing list conversations that
discuss this issue:

1. https://lists.opendaylight.org/pipermail/neutron-dev/2017-December/001499.html
2. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125466.html

commit_message:
Remove unit tests for ML2 Mechanism driver

The test cases importing `neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_plugin` and
creating classes with noop operation [1] follow a faulted pattern. The
reasons are twofold:

1. If the mechanism driver is not loaded correctly [2], the tests then
don't test the mechanism driver but still succeed and therefore there is
no indication that there is something wrong with the code.

2. It gives a false sense of reassurance. If the code of those tests is
analyzed it's possible to see that the code itself is mostly centered
around testing the REST endpoint of neutron than actually testing that
the mechanism succeeds on the operation it was supposed to test. As a
result of this, there is marginally added value on having those tests.
To be clear, the hooks for the respective operations are called on the
mechanism driver, but the result of the operation is not asserted.

For more reference please refer to the mailing list conversations that
discuss this issue:

1. https://lists.opendaylight.org/pipermail/neutron-dev/2017-December/001499.html
2. http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125466.html

[1]: http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=class%20.*\(.*TestMl2
[2]: something that was happening in networking-odl and addressed by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/523934

Change-Id: I242a7f69d62f6e3365164cf8d104a5cf0a8499b0
