[{'created': '2018-01-30 13:51:19.000000000', 'message': 'Pause ubuntu-xenial image uploads

Our Ubuntu Xenial package mirrors have fallen behind again, so newly
built ubuntu-xenial images boot a system unable to install packages
due to dependency version conflicts. Pause these for now so we can
roll back to the previous images while we work on fixing our mirror
updates.

Change-Id: I73124c6543554bb4456f36c0822ba2b8d00b523f
'}]
commit_message:
Pause ubuntu-xenial image uploads

Our Ubuntu Xenial package mirrors have fallen behind again, so newly
built ubuntu-xenial images boot a system unable to install packages
due to dependency version conflicts. Pause these for now so we can
roll back to the previous images while we work on fixing our mirror
updates.

Change-Id: I73124c6543554bb4456f36c0822ba2b8d00b523f

subject: set paginated to False for list operations
messages:
[{'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:08:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 09:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-30 13:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Terribly sorry, but I disagree fundamentally with the premise stated:

  "For general purpose, consumers of the list operations are
   expecting only the first page of the results, no matter
   whether limit or marker is set."

A user who does:

  for server in conn.servers():

is expressing that they want a list of the servers. If they want less than the total number of servers, they can simply stop iterating.

The problem with having pagination be opt-in is that services can paginate without the user requesting. If an project has more than 1000 servers, for instance, nova will, by default, paginate and only return the first 1000. If we did not paginate by default, that user would erroneously receive less servers than expected.

limit expresses page size, which is consistent with how limit works at the REST level.

It is possible/likely that the documentation needs to be updated or clarified - but list operations traversing pagination to return all results as the default behavior is the intended behavior.'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Monty:
Thank you for the review and the clarification. It seems that I totally misunderstood the usage of paginated and took the wrong approach. Is it used to indicate that whether the resource MAY be returned across multiple pages? So for resources like nova servers it should be always set to True?'}, {'account_id': 21781, 'date': '2018-01-30 14:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 07:08:02.000000000', 'message': 'set paginated to False for list operations

For general purpose, consumers of the list operations are expecting only
the first page of the results, no matter whether limit or marker is set.
Thus using paginated=True in these operations hardly makes sense.

And the worse thing is that when paginated is set to True with limit
being set, the limit parameter will in fact limits the amount of entries
in each page, the generator will keep yielding objects with more than
one API calls made, and the total number of items being return from the
query is not limited as expected.

Change-Id: If1acda830439ae0b1d4b363b7a8e32e68397bcd3
Closes-Bug: #1716760
'}, {'created': '2018-01-30 07:10:18.000000000', 'message': 'set paginated to False for list operations

'}]
commit_message:
set paginated to False for list operations

For general purpose, consumers of the list operations are expecting only
the first page of the results, no matter whether limit or marker is set.
Thus using paginated=True in these operations hardly makes sense.

And the worse thing is that when paginated is set to True with limit
being set, the limit parameter will in fact limit the amount of entries
in each page, the generator will keep yielding objects with more than
one API calls made, and the total number of items being return from the
query is not limited as expected.

Change-Id: If1acda830439ae0b1d4b363b7a8e32e68397bcd3
Closes-Bug: #1716760

commit_message:
Fix wrong version of libssl for couchdbase

The couchbase guest image can't be built due to a wrong version
of libssl package.

The version 0.9.8 is no longer available.

https://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/libssl-dev

Closes-Bug: #1746117
Change-Id: Iaf9c6aad2e154a1385860290bcdb4eefaaf36540

commit_message:
Add masakari and service-type instance-ha

The masakari project is an Official OpenStack project.

It has used the 'ha' service-type up until now, but that's a bit broad.
It was agreed that 'instance-ha' would be better. Add it to the registry.

The api-ref documentation is not currently published, but it does exist
in tree:

  http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/masakari/tree/api-ref/source

The jobs to publish it have been added:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/534878

but as the api-ref publication jobs use service-types-authority to
determine the correct place to publish to, the api-ref docs won't exist
until we land this. Once we do and once a publication job runs, they
should be found at the appropriate place.

Change-Id: Icdd0b09060ddd71b2313a90c1d62d84c31cdbb8d

commit_message:
Add .zuul.yaml file with tox job

Move legacy tox job in-tree and convert to Zuul v3 native syntax.

Use tox as parent, we do not need constraints setup.

Name the job "publish" instead of previously validate since it calls
the publish environment.

Change-Id: Ib676370e4ccf6c6a0c2f9384a0e023b54521a3b7

[{'created': '2017-09-29 08:56:48.000000000', 'message': 'Replace .testr.conf with .stestr.conf

In this change [1] os_testr changed under the covers from using
testr to stestr, so that we now get the following warning:

 ostestr.py:120:
 UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD.
 Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a
 script to do this in the stestr git repository.

So remove the .testr.conf and add .stestr.conf which was
generated using a utility script as documented here [2].

[1] Id7cb2a39a8308f1413608dcf19273a1d7f33592e
[2] https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/stestr/stable/stestr.pdf

Change-Id: Ib03d62bea8b2c28847943cd891776cf118e821d6
'}]
commit_message:
Replace .testr.conf with .stestr.conf

In this change [1] os_testr changed under the covers from using
testr to stestr, so that we now get the following warning:

 ostestr.py:120:
 UserWarning: No .stestr.conf file found in the CWD.
 Please create one to to replace the .testr.conf. You can find a
 script to do this in the stestr git repository.

So remove the .testr.conf and add .stestr.conf which was
generated using a utility script as documented here [2].

[1] Id7cb2a39a8308f1413608dcf19273a1d7f33592e
[2] https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/stestr/stable/stestr.pdf

Change-Id: Ib03d62bea8b2c28847943cd891776cf118e821d6

commit_message:
hyper-v: Deprecates support for Windows / Hyper-V Server 2012

Starting with Rocky, we will support only Windows / Hyper-V Server
2012 R2 or newer.

Change-Id: I6844a0664860d09ecd259cea7715fe50814b5362

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration[1].
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Change-Id: Iddf89707289a22ea322c14d1b11f58840871304d

commit_message:
Fixed ec2api_tempest_plugin test discovery issue

* On running tempest run -l, the ec2api-tempest-plugin is giving
  ImportError: Start directory is not importable: '/tmp/.venv/
  lib/python2.7/ec2api_tempest_plugin'. It is fixed by fixing
  the test discovery path.

* Added lxml and tempest as a Requires for the plugin.

Change-Id: Ie64d0e96565980201143c0547c8b63513c883ea4

commit_message:
Use single quotes instead of backquotes for i18n string

Using the backquotes causes the new lines to appear as is in the pot
files, making the pot file invalid and causing the upload to Zanata to
fail with the "missing end-quote" error.

Change-Id: I820cac7ad401bd0e0c0e31f088c4efede3263ff2
Closes-Bug: #1737577

Add tripleo-ui image to skipped image list

There is some issue on tripleo-ui side, which block the kolla gate.
Revert me when https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1744215 is
fixed.

Fixed.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:05:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Thanks Rishabh. I think this control should be added here
 > https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L845.
 > Here is where we check tempest status and we set up the config.

With this commit, I am trying to make sure that stack.sh won't crash when manila-tempest-plugin is not enabled, which has always happened  for me.

I think not running manila tempest tests by default (i.e. setting manila to False in service_available section of tempest.conf) needs to be a separate patch. If you agree I will push it."}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:09:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-manila-infinibox http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/95/536795/2/check/dsvm-tempest-manila-infinibox/73bdc68 : FAILURE in 47m 04s"}, {'account_id': 21884, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Build succeed.

- EMC_Unity_Manila http://publiclogs.emc.com/536795/2/EMC_Unity_Manila/600 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 30s

Leave a comment with 'run-dell-emc-unity' to trigger a recheck, for more information about CI, please see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/emc-unity-ci"}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- dsvm-veritas-access-manila-driver http://52.42.67.99/95/536795/2/check/dsvm-veritas-access-manila-driver/8e716ae : SUCCESS in 1h 50m 18s'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If the problem is that the manila tempest plugin sets service_available to True when installed,, then the manila tempest plugin should not set that value to True, and this patch is not really needed.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:36:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> If the problem is that the manila tempest plugin sets
 > service_available to True when installed,, then the manila tempest
 > plugin should not set that value to True, and this patch is not
 > really needed.

The problem is that manila/devstack/settings adds manila-tempest-plugin to to-be-installed list even when it is not enabled (which leads to a crash). This is is what this patch aims to fix.

There were 2 assumptions when manila_tempest_test was inside manila repo -

1. manila_tempest_tests can be installed with the download of manila repo.
2. Manila tempest tests can be executed due to point #1.

Both of these aren't true since manila-tempest-plugin moved out."}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:03:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Left a few comments inline. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6413, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-27 14:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-27 14:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Just a couple remarks on how to debug these failures.

1) Look at the main console output for one of the voting jobs (e.g. manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm-centos-7) and search for 'RECAP' to find ansible reporting 'failed: 1'.  Back up from there for the ERROR:

http://logs.openstack.org/95/536795/3/check/manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-cephfs-nfs-centos-7/5c76278/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-01-27_14_53_36_829046

OK, 'main setup script' failed.  So look into the logs directory for devstack logs as these   

2) I usually start with devstack-early.txt.gz since the devstack logs pertain to the 'setup' that failed.  Here we see:

http://logs.openstack.org/95/536795/3/check/manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-cephfs-nfs-centos-7/5c76278/logs/devstack-early.txt.gz#_2018-01-27_14_53_31_817"}, {'account_id': 27697, 'date': '2018-01-27 15:28:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Update proliantutils version for Queens release

This commit updates the proliantutils version required in
Ironic to 2.5.0 for Queens release. This version of
proliantutils includes a major bug fix that requires proliantutils
library to align with sushy library changes which were introduced in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531295/. Without this the code errs
out while trying to hit redfish APIs.

Change-Id: I2566b940b4d0ae045f851e0c4f30e03993ab99ac

commit_message:
Kaminario K2: Add non discovery iSCSI multipath

Current Kaminario K2 driver only supports iSCSI multipathing using
discovery (sendtargets), which in some cases may be undesirable, since a
broken primary path could prevent an attachment.

This code adds the possibility of not using discovery mode and return
all connection information when `initialize_connection` is called, which
should provide increased reliability.

Change-Id: I7932b1d952844b49cfdb504ed0ba188b489d7f44
(cherry picked from commit c9ec9b9bd755f042dbe1ccbdc5e3ff87fa60269c)
(cherry picked from commit 7bcb2ff94cf38eaa9def1115569981760e36510c)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I92bca888ccda64459b00172b79850b72e192a1ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 09:04:25.000000000', 'message': 'Set error names explicitly

Setting error names explicitly in constructor ensures that code mangling
for production provided by UglifyJS does not break error handling logic.

UglifyJS mangles Error.prototype.name by default.

Closes-Bug: 1745944
Change-Id: Id0ae3b9427a07a1910e7a6976da76a06abb104f1
'}]
commit_message:
Set error names explicitly

Setting error names explicitly in constructor ensures that code mangling
for production provided by UglifyJS does not break error handling logic.

UglifyJS mangles Error.prototype.name by default.

Closes-Bug: 1745944
Change-Id: Id0ae3b9427a07a1910e7a6976da76a06abb104f1

commit_message:
Adding octavia required roles

Adding following role which is reuqired by octavia services

- load-balancer_observer
- load-balancer_global_observer
- load-balancer_member
- load-balancer_admin
- load-balancer_quota_admin

Change-Id: I6f351c96915b09cb9a6ef716515b45785d62cb90
Closes-Bug: #1745915

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 14:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adding ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range parameter to globals.yml

In order for the ironic_dnsmasq container to successfully
run the "ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range" needs to have beginning
and end values. Even though the parameter is present in
ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml, the appropriate
place to set these values is globals.yml

Change-Id: I2801c84510b6e1d929f4a6a6334142ff16eefea0
Closes-Bug: 1746005
'}]
commit_message:
Adding ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range parameter to globals.yml

In order for the ironic_dnsmasq container to successfully
run the "ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range" needs to have beginning
and end values. Even though the parameter is present in
ansible/roles/ironic/defaults/main.yml, the appropriate
place to set these values is globals.yml

Change-Id: I2801c84510b6e1d929f4a6a6334142ff16eefea0
Closes-Bug: 1746005

[{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-03 10:54:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-04 14:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-08 20:07:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-08 20:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-09 00:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:39:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't agree with this change. This test wasn't added to verify that we create a new port when updating without an IP address, it was added (in I74eb115de520d8a66abd1621522f0c605201019a) to verify that changing the subnet of a port works and we don't get a regression of bug 1533570.

So the answer isn't to disable the test and then turn it into a test of some other thing once the patch lands; it's to rewrite the test to make sure it's testing the Right Thing both before and after the changes land in Heat. We can then add _new_ tests to test any new behaviour we want.

In this case I think we want to switch the subnet of the port to a different one."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-21 03:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-21 03:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I don't agree with this change. This test wasn't added to verify
 > that we create a new port when updating without an IP address, it
 > was added (in I74eb115de520d8a66abd1621522f0c605201019a) to verify
 > that changing the subnet of a port works and we don't get a
 > regression of bug 1533570.
 > 
 > So the answer isn't to disable the test and then turn it into a
 > test of some other thing once the patch lands; it's to rewrite the
 > test to make sure it's testing the Right Thing both before and
 > after the changes land in Heat. We can then add _new_ tests to test
 > any new behaviour we want.
 > 
 > In this case I think we want to switch the subnet of the port to a
 > different one.

Nice catch. Test updated to switch subnet_a to subnet_b."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-01-21 05:02:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This LGTM. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-29 20:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-30 07:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-01-21 03:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update test to check subnet change

This test was added to verify that changing the subnet
of a port works, and ensure no regression of bug 1533570.

Currently it tests that a port can be updated without
fixed_ip when this was previously set, but the subnet
remain the same. This patch updates the test to verify

Change-Id: Ic4bbbcc3cee329a4de8f0eac710128175c4fc397

commit_message:
Update test to check subnet change

This test was added to verify that changing the subnet
of a port works, and ensure no regression of bug 1533570.

Currently it tests that a port can be updated without
fixed_ip when this was previously set, but the subnet
remain the same. This patch updates the test to verify
change from subnet_a to subnet_b.

Related-Bug: #1533570
Change-Id: Ic4bbbcc3cee329a4de8f0eac710128175c4fc397

[{'created': '2018-01-25 18:40:17.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: update migration_policy retype note about encrypted volumes

Nova has historically not supported swap volume operations (via
cinder volume retype / volume migration) for an in-use encrypted
volume.

That was recently addressed via nova bug 1739593.

However, as of change Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
in nova, depending on the version of libvirt/qemu on the compute host,
a luks-encrypted volume will use native qemu luks decryption. That
does not yet support blockRebase operations which are used during
swap volume due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=760547.

So it's safe to say that for now, a retype which involves a volume
migration is not supported for an in-use encrypted volume.

Change-Id: I7ce992f51d50d00950d3fc4ebb44b69a31a94787
Related-Bug: #1739593
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: update migration_policy retype note about encrypted volumes

Nova has historically not supported swap volume operations (via
cinder volume retype / volume migration) for an in-use encrypted
volume.

That was recently addressed via nova bug 1739593.

However, as of change Ibfa64f18bbd2fb70db7791330ed1a64fe61c1355
in nova, depending on the version of libvirt/qemu on the compute host,
a luks-encrypted volume will use native qemu luks decryption. That
does not yet support blockRebase operations which are used during
swap volume due to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=760547.

So it's safe to say that for now, a retype which involves a volume
migration is not supported for an in-use encrypted volume.

Change-Id: I7ce992f51d50d00950d3fc4ebb44b69a31a94787
Related-Bug: #1739593

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 22:13:59.000000000', 'message': "VMware:Config option to disable lazy volume create

Currently the backend volume is created lazily for raw
volume create operations. The backend volume is created
during the initial attach. This is to minimize unnecessary
volume migrations across datastores in the backend which
may be required if the backend volume is not accessible to
instance VM's ESX host. In certain vCenter configurations,
it may be required to disable this lazy creation. This would
reduce the time spent in the backend during volume attach.
Introducing a config option to disable lazy volume create
if necessary.

Change-Id: I3feb6b382ff75eb53d53f145ae3773b6320e703c
Closes-bug: #1739390
"}]
commit_message:
VMware:Config option to disable lazy volume create

Currently the backend volume is created lazily for raw
volume create operations. The backend volume is created
during the initial attach. This is to minimize unnecessary
volume migrations across datastores in the backend which
may be required if the backend volume is not accessible to
instance VM's ESX host. In certain vCenter configurations,
it may be required to disable this lazy creation. This would
reduce the time spent in the backend during volume attach.
Introducing a config option to disable lazy volume create
if necessary.

Change-Id: I3feb6b382ff75eb53d53f145ae3773b6320e703c
Closes-bug: #1739390

[{'created': '2018-01-26 12:49:15.000000000', 'message': "[Trivial] SMBFS: fix provisioning type usage

At the moment, the SMBFS driver does not honor the configured
provisioning type.

The issue is that we're checking CONF.backend_defaults instead
of the driver configuration object, for which reason if the option
is defined in the according backend config group, it will be ignored.

This change fixes this issue, updating the config option checks.

Change-Id: Ieb9e9edb1bc46d8b6ca31480d963f9dc9c2331de
Closes-Bug: #1745602
"}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] SMBFS: fix provisioning type usage

At the moment, the SMBFS driver does not honor the configured
provisioning type.

The issue is that we're checking CONF.backend_defaults instead
of the driver configuration object, for which reason if the option
is defined in the according backend config group, it will be ignored.

This change fixes this issue, updating the config option checks.

Change-Id: Ieb9e9edb1bc46d8b6ca31480d963f9dc9c2331de
Closes-Bug: #1745602

[{'created': '2018-01-25 20:52:10.000000000', 'message': 'backup: set default swiftclient log level to WARN

Similar to change I0857cecd7d8ab0ee7e3e9bd6e15f4987ede4d653, the
swift backup driver cannot be logging stuff while in a thread during
read and write operations. swiftclient logs requests and responses
at DEBUG level, which can cause a thread switch and break the backup
operation.

This sets a default log level of WARN for swiftclient for the
cinder-backup service.

Change-Id: I67ac11276715290839c39fc1d0e333c61a38c461
Closes-Bug: #1745168
'}]
commit_message:
backup: set default swiftclient log level to WARN

Similar to change I0857cecd7d8ab0ee7e3e9bd6e15f4987ede4d653, the
swift backup driver cannot be logging stuff while in a thread during
read and write operations. swiftclient logs requests and responses
at DEBUG level, which can cause a thread switch and break the backup
operation.

This sets a default log level of WARN for swiftclient for the
cinder-backup service.

Change-Id: I67ac11276715290839c39fc1d0e333c61a38c461
Closes-Bug: #1745168

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 18:51:59.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: add multiattach considerations to retype docs

This adds some notes about two things to consider with a volume
retype operation on an in-use multiattach volume:

1. The volume API will reject a retype operation on an in-use volume
   where the volume's multiattach value would change.

2. Retyping an in-use volume that has more than one active read/write
   attachment is not recommended because on the nova side the swap
   volume operation performs a blockRebase which could potentially
   lead to data corruption.

In the future, we (nova or cinder or both) will likely need to make
some changes as to what the default attach_mode is for secondary
attachments to a multiattach volume, since today we default to read/write
if it's not specified by the caller when making the attachment.

Change-Id: Ib5a2830ea3cd37236947677225252ef42edaa347
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: add multiattach considerations to retype docs

This adds some notes about two things to consider with a volume
retype operation on an in-use multiattach volume:

1. The volume API will reject a retype operation on an in-use volume
   where the volume's multiattach value would change.

2. Retyping an in-use volume that has more than one active read/write
   attachment is not recommended because on the nova side the swap
   volume operation performs a blockRebase which could potentially
   lead to data corruption.

In the future, we (nova or cinder or both) will likely need to make
some changes as to what the default attach_mode is for secondary
attachments to a multiattach volume, since today we default to read/write
if it's not specified by the caller when making the attachment.

Change-Id: Ib5a2830ea3cd37236947677225252ef42edaa347

[{'created': '2018-01-17 17:45:56.000000000', 'message': 'Netapp Ontap: Adds support for auto-max-over-subscription

After the addition of the auto-max-over-subscription on Cinder, drivers that
somehow used the CONF.max_over_subscription_ratio in the driver where marked as
not supporting the feature. As Netapp Ontap drivers used the option to do some
calculations, they were marked as so.

In this patch we remove the function that did this calculation as the function
(_share_has_space_for_clone() is not actually necessary as currectly all volume
clones are checked by the scheduler.)

Change-Id: I25713b402ad93e0b4aa1861b4ccd9e05ee496200

commit_message:
Netapp Ontap: Adds support for auto-max-over-subscription

After the addition of the auto-max-over-subscription on Cinder, drivers that
somehow used the CONF.max_over_subscription_ratio in the driver where marked as
not supporting the feature. As Netapp Ontap drivers used the option to do some
calculations, they were marked as so.

In this patch we remove the function that did this calculation as the function
(_share_has_space_for_clone() is not actually necessary as currectly all volume
clones are checked by the scheduler.)

Change-Id: I25713b402ad93e0b4aa1861b4ccd9e05ee496200
Depends-on: If30bb6276f58532c0f78ac268544a8804008770e

commit_message:
Fix mis-named context object

Multiattach will fail with an AttributeError because the authorize
is called on the wrong object. This corrects that.

Change-Id: I439f2afe34afc9399a5592e8cb75fb6a287d02ab
Closes-Bug: 1745209

subject: Add debug logging around multiattach status changes

commit_message:
Add debug logging around multiattach status changes

When deleting an attachment, we now need to check for any other
attachments for the volume and try to set the status correctly
based on any of those remaining attachments.

There's not very much logging around this to help us out if
something goes wrong, so this patch just proposes some debug
level logging be added around the process.

Change-Id: I64b3046cfb3355b547e158783131338b8b0180d1

commit_message:
Remove deletion policy 1.0 from tests

Modify policy show type tests from using deletion policy to using
scaling policy.  This change is needed to pass test cases for
the commit which increments to deletion policy 1.1

Change-Id: Id7804abc351c063563b58fb69a66074d0d854ecf

commit_message:
Allow for optinal volumes and env variables

This patch will allow to attach optional volumes and env variables to the
neutron-api, heat-api and nova-compute containers.

Change-Id: I95cd5017fdbbec257d274b805be4509ec32f9019
Closes-Bug: 1741464
(cherry picked from commit b83a62fe007b5461881d53d5a224a0678cc3f00e)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie6b601b7ddb66735b069b0d7880bd29433f794ae

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example ,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
 admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: I359c3b84643df2219b51715021f253257f8f29a2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10459, 'name': 'Luigi Toscano', 'email': 'ltoscano@redhat.com', 'username': 'ltoscano'}, {'_account_id': 11278, 'name': 'Anusha Ramineni', 'email': 'anusha.ramineni@india.nec.com', 'username': 'anusha08'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 09:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for the patch. one comment inline'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:00:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As discussed on IRC, I think that this is not the right approach. 
Devstack introduced plugins so that a service that it's not configured by the core devstack can be *totally* configured by its Devstack plugin.

So I think that the list should only contain the services directly configured by devstack. Every other service, configured through a devstack plugin, should:
a) default the value of service_available.<service> to False; and
b) set the value of service_available.<service> to True in the relevant step (test-config) of the devstack plugin.

For example in Sahara we implement b):
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/sahara/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n252

and I'm going to file a patch which fixes a).

-1 because at least sahara should not be in the list, if not all other services."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:16:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Luigi Toscano 

>a) default the value of service_available.<service> to False; and
It is always true as default on each plugin side. This config option is register on tempest plugin side not by service. 

regarding doing these on devstack plugin side, we can do that but that did not happen and leads to this bug. I do not think its too bad to set the tempest required service in common place o0n devstack side.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:22:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

i am not very against of doing it on devstack plugin side but i prefer this because:

1. every service having tempest plugin did not register their service in their devstack plugin and lead to this bug.

2. it is easy to miss and difficult to track whether every service having tempest plugin has registered their service for tempest in devstack plugin.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

one more point that why it would not work when setting on devstack plugin side. If service is not setup which means their devstack plugin will not set the service availability on tempest and it stay as True because every plugin have it default to True.

We can make default value to False but that backward incompatible change we need that with upgrade notes, that seems not worth for me for small benefit.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I agree with Luigi, this is not the correct approach. The devstack plugins that are installing/configuring the tempest plugins should control whether the service is available or not. Devstack should only concern itself with the base services in tempest and devstack itself.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:40:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@matt but that would not work as service default value is True in every plugin. changing that to False make change in every CI etc not to break them.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:42:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

then that is a bug in the tempest plugin, or the test job configuring tempest. Devstack can't keep track of all the tempest plugins out there and what they might possibly add into the service available config group."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:42:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Also, why would a job install a tempest plugin for a service that's not running?"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-24 03:55:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

congress use case is they want to skip congress's aodh test case on py35 job(as aodh is not ready for py35) and run on other job. For that they need to have service_available[aodh] with correct value to make decision on skipping or run the congress's aodh test.

So setting it on aodh's devstack plugin would not work here due to default value of service_available[aodh] True.

as discussed on IRC, let's try to do this on congress side based on job definition."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

doing it on plugin side.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 09:11:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix service_available on Tempest side

In Devstack, TEMPEST_SERVICES is not supported now and
tempest sercice availability setting had been made with
local variable (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281788).
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Based on local tempest_services devstack register the
available services on tempest side
- https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/614cab33c40159f0bc10d92c9f8dc3f9783708d9/lib/tempest#L528

Almost all tempest plugin still using unsupported global variable
TEMPEST_SERVICES in impressions that they have registered them as
service available on tempest side which is not the case.

- http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=TEMPEST_SERVICES&i=nope&files=&repos=

Below is plan to solve this issue which exist for almost all the plugins
1. make all tempest plugin services set by devstack with local variable - This patch.
2. remove unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES setting for all plugins. - Separate patch
3. any new tempest plugin want their testing service to available in tempest should
   register that in devstack itself.

Change-Id: I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4
Closes-Bug: #1743688

commit_message:
Fix service_available on Tempest side

In Devstack, TEMPEST_SERVICES is not supported now and
tempest sercice availability setting had been made with
local variable (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281788).
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Based on local tempest_services devstack register the
available services on tempest side
- https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/614cab33c40159f0bc10d92c9f8dc3f9783708d9/lib/tempest#L528

Almost all tempest plugin still using unsupported global variable
TEMPEST_SERVICES in impressions that they have registered them as
service available on tempest side which is not the case.

- http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=TEMPEST_SERVICES&i=nope&files=&repos=

Below is plan to solve this issue which exist for almost all the plugins
1. make all tempest plugin services set by devstack with local variable - This patch.
2. remove unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES setting for all plugins. - Separate patch
3. any new tempest plugin want their testing service to available in tempest should
   register that in devstack itself.

Depends-On: I7739e0b672a7211a1d643543fdc79031affa0a0b
Change-Id: I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4
Closes-Bug: #1743688

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4657ace87dfc3e6d9d88bddb431e211e65000f81

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-29 22:31:24.000000000', 'message': 'Correct start date for Pike+Queens contributions

The Pike release cycle started on or around the date of the Ocata
release, not the Pike release. Since the TC charter defines the PTL
electorate (APCs) as "Individual Members who committed a change to a
repository of a project over the last two 6-month release cycles" we
need to include back as far as February 22, 2017.

In prior elections, the start was considered the end of the release
day (23 hours 59 minutes UTC), so preserve that quirk for
consistency. We can revisit that choice in later elections.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/charter.html#voters-for-ptl-seats-apc
https://releases.openstack.org/ocata/index.html

Change-Id: I08fb6f994d3d05d26f5b0fd7495056e3065f38e1
'}]
commit_message:
Correct start date for Pike+Queens contributions

The Pike release cycle started on or around the date of the Ocata
release, not the Pike release. Since the TC charter defines the PTL
electorate (APCs) as "Individual Members who committed a change to a
repository of a project over the last two 6-month release cycles" we
need to include back as far as February 22, 2017.

In prior elections, the start was considered the end of the release
day (23 hours 59 minutes UTC), so preserve that quirk for
consistency. We can revisit that choice in later elections.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/charter.html#voters-for-ptl-seats-apc
https://releases.openstack.org/ocata/index.html

Change-Id: I08fb6f994d3d05d26f5b0fd7495056e3065f38e1

Support policy.yaml file [part 2]

- Keystone
- Glance
- Nova
- Cinder

This will copy only yaml or json policy file if they exist.

The current template guide does not show required/optional flag
for subproperties, it means that users need to look at the source
code to clarify if the subproperties is required or not.

required/optional flag for subproperties.

Closes-Bug: #1694748
'}]
commit_message:
Updated the template guide.

The current template guide does not show required/optional flag
for subproperties, it means that users need to look at the source
code to clarify if the subproperties is required or not.
Updated a sphinx extension doc/ext/resource.py to display
required/optional flag for subproperties.

Change-Id: Ie9e23d633d749aa7ad087330520cd3b83294794a
Closes-Bug: #1694748

commit_message:
Changed message attribute to _msg_fmt

Changed message attribute to _msg_fmt, so that ironic.IronicException
can subclass from this ironic_lib.BaseIronicException class. Changed
name of class from IronicException to BaseIronicException.

Change-Id: Id2ce130d2557e193c0f7e34b4275aeef474ee226

commit_message:
Select Roles feature

* Available Roles actions, selectors and reducer
* SelectRolesDialog, Form and AvailableRoleInput
* NodesAssignment reorganization and update
* FloatingToolbar component

Implements: blueprint tripleo-ui-select-roles
Depends-On: I23087bd38c3730c9f24e03e4d7c54688ae912b08
Change-Id: I1f30c46fa78b05a4dd06d657596327e680add608

prove that the request id information is included as part of the
"context" portion of the data sent to the formatter.

commit_message:
update structured logging tests to prove context id is included

Add checks to the tests for the JSONFormatter and FluentFormatter to
prove that the request id information is included as part of the
"context" portion of the data sent to the formatter.

Change-Id: If740897dbf1c3c01ecbb75f8509444022f2f05ba
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Move swift-drive-audit code to swift/cli/drive_audit

The main motivation for this work is that I'd like to add more
unit test to make sure if a bug exists or not, that is reported
at https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1266554.

WIP because I didn't reach the statement in the bug report.

Change-Id: Id350d654afe306c4b5cce4296bbce8e8a0b572da

commit_message:
The rolling-upgrade feature for Designate

- Listed out detail work items in the specification document.
- Listed out detail primary assignee.
- Added assert "assert:supports-accessible-upgrade" tag for
  Designate before "assert:supports-rolling-upgrade" tag.
- Explain further info about Trigger solutions.

Change-Id: I7492820184110da2f5774cac00b266c63eadbfcb

commit_message:
Add Application Credentials controller

Add the controller, router, schema, and policies for application
credentials. If a secret is not provided, one is generated at the
controller layer.

bp application-credentials

Depends-on: Id26a2790acae25f80bd28a8cb121c80cb5064645
Depends-on: Icbd58464182b082854fb5d73ccc93c900ede020c

Change-Id: I7a371d59c19a11e55f17baf12d92327c1258533d

[{'created': '2018-01-19 16:48:32.000000000', 'message': 'override_role cleanup: Remove superfluous call in rbac_rule_validation

This PS cleans up rbac_rule_validation (addressing a TODO) by removing
_override_role call in rbac_utils which is no longer necessary as all
tests have migrated over to override_role.

The call in rbac_rule_validation to _override_role was only needed
to do a role switch to admin role after test execution to compensate
for the limitation in switch_role which did not automatically switch
role via a contextmanager (which is what override_role) does.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I5628886349b22b10b53a3c325fd38bdbaaafafae

commit_message:
override_role cleanup: Remove superfluous call in rbac_rule_validation

This PS cleans up rbac_rule_validation (addressing a TODO) by removing
_override_role call in rbac_utils which is no longer necessary as all
tests have migrated over to override_role.

The call in rbac_rule_validation to _override_role was only needed
to do a role switch to admin role after test execution to compensate
for the limitation in switch_role which did not automatically switch
role via a contextmanager (which is what override_role) does.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I5628886349b22b10b53a3c325fd38bdbaaafafae

commit_message:
Remove project name from Zuul

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic7de7331afc5e3abefcf364ba562f4c9283c5f77

commit_message:
Run command doc8 in pep8 test

The gate will not run command "tox -e doc" to test document build,
the command is used by developer, so move doc8 test into
section [testenv:pep8].

Change-Id: I1a017e817b77b47f55e2059acefded0eac28925b

commit_message:
Allow 'size' to be an integer

This allows the 'size' attribute (inside 'mounts' parameter) to
be an integer. This makes the API friendly to Heat because
Heat will pass an integer to Zun (if it is not quoted).

Change-Id: Idee6b8d7f37dfa359c922c79ccbb378aee561058

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 13:40:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

masakari does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the TEMPEST_SERVICES setting.

Change-Id: I30673a3d739e013caec2b8d4a2295d71ab40e491
Related-Bug: #1743688
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

masakari does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the TEMPEST_SERVICES setting.

Change-Id: I30673a3d739e013caec2b8d4a2295d71ab40e491
Related-Bug: #1743688

The requirements sync for openstack/ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin and
openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder fails since those repositories are
completely empty. Remove them from project list, there's no need to
update them if they always fail. AFAIK there are no plans to use these
anymore.

"}]
commit_message:
Remove empty ironic projects

The requirements sync for openstack/ironic-inspector-tempest-plugin and
openstack/ironic-python-agent-builder fails since those repositories are
completely empty. Remove them from project list, there's no need to
update them if they always fail. AFAIK there are no plans to use these
anymore.

Change-Id: I5f784b774a3aef527177241fc046a908bb017b7e

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I40c446df59cdc4b4912b9efb3439089f438554b9

subject: "list_own_user_projects" test using wrong policy rule name The test should use the "list_projects_for_user" policy rule name as specified under api-ref[0] and tempest endpoint [1]
messages:
[{'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-01-05 06:30:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-01-05 10:20:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is incorrect because "list_projects_for_user" corresponds to /v3/auth/projects, not /v3/users/{user_id}/projects:

https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/4e986235713758f2df5ae12e66ca3e5e93edd551/keystone/common/policies/user.py#L39

list_user_projects -> GET users/{user_id}/projects <-> "list_user_projects" policy as per: https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/c59c660a105efe7fc5e74bbcd4b3c35c5e07f47c/keystone/common/policies/project.py#L34'}, {'account_id': 25695, 'date': '2018-01-06 14:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

commit_message:
"list_own_user_projects" test using wrong policy rule name
The test should use the "list_projects_for_user" policy
rule name as specified under api-ref[0] and tempest endpoint [1]

[0]https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/#list-projects-for-user
[1]https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/18026ce378491fb74ed872cae1690ac6b2cdf658/tempest/lib/services/identity/v3/users_client.py#L64

Change-Id: Id84e24b148abb0a721d64f37060cb569f36534c6

commit_message:
Refactor the storage backend

This adds an hybrid storage backend to CloudKitty. It aims at splitting the
processor state management and the dataframe storage part. The default backend
for this storage is gnocchi, but other backends will be implemented in the
future.

This storage backend is a standard storage module for now, but it will become
the default storage once it is considered stable. Once this new storage type
has become the default, storage backend creation will be easier (no state
handling).

Change-Id: I61c0c17230350b12be3484ea4b5805960aa33099
Story: 2001372

commit_message:
Fix tox -e venv -- reno new <slug>

Change I7e8c47dead1e019e8705db3ff7559dd39b1d90d9 broke
the ability to create a new release note from the venv
tox target because the reno requirement was moved from
test-requirements.txt. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Ifac83121388728fa445e0ed4433c9d981c057737

Please reference a bug, and also the test is needed.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2017-05-27 08:02:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Thanks so much for trying to help us, still please follow commit guideline here: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages
That will make people more understand what you targeting. And please register a bug in blueprint and reference it from patch if it's really a bug."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-26 21:55:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

So this is technically correct, but from a practical perspective the reason we include int here is because yaml opportunistically converts strings to ints unless you explicitly put quotes around them, unlike JSON where they have distinct syntax. The code is like this to ensure that users don't have to deal with manually putting quotes. But I don't feel the need to be pedantic about it in the error message - most users won't know the difference between a string and an int in yaml anyway, and that's the whole reason we're doing this."}, {'account_id': 24269, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
code optimization

    when key is a string(such as "2"), and collection is a list,
collection[key] will raise an exception. therefore key need to be
translated into an integer before executing the
code "return collection[key]".

Change-Id: I77451d267d52ade5d1bce451af699be237a7ab43

[{'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:19:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:27:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

What about other distros?  Is there an equivalent requirement for RPM based distros?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

So, which projects use python-pcre?

This is the default for all projects - if only a few repos are affected, then it should be added to just their setup.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=python-pcre&i=nope&files=&repos= shows me that whereto is the only project using it.

So, where exactly is this failing?'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:33:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

https://github.com/openstack/requirements/commit/89cebce27b7bd84260ea8e01a3fff1b64851e41d 
it's added as a dep from another module it looks like.
Devstack will try to install all of the packages listed in the upper-constraints."}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:40:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

devstack is *not* installing everything from upper-constraints, so just having a file in upper-constraints is not a requirement to install dependencies.

I'm missing something here - explain the problem that you actually hit and give a link to a sample failure."}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Andreas, I use devstack to setup two nodes env. One node is configured as controller which has most of the openstack services enabled (e.g. nova-api, nova-compute, neutron, horizon, glance...); the other is configured as compute node which only has some compute relative services enabled(e.g. nova-compute, neutron-ovs-agt).

The stack.sh failed on the compute node. I pasted the log in https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1745935'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:51:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Anyway, it tries to install python-pcre in the compute node; but libpcre3-dev is not installed.'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 09:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Andreas, yes. I think the module of whereto looped in pcre as the depends package.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

You pasted snippets from a log file - but where does it come from? Please link to the complete logs...'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Andreas, here is the full stack log: http://dd6b71949550285df7dc-dda4e480e005aaa13ec303551d2d8155.r49.cf1.rackcdn.com/bug_1745935/'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-01-29 12:34:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To be clearer, failing log example is http://dd6b71949550285df7dc-dda4e480e005aaa13ec303551d2d8155.r49.cf1.rackcdn.com/49/479949/32/check/dsvm-tempest-neutron-network/ddc520f/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz

sudo -H http_proxy= https_proxy= no_proxy= PIP_FIND_LINKS= SETUPTOOLS_SYS_PATH_TECHNIQUE=rewrite /usr/local/bin/pip2.7 install -c /opt/stack/new/requirements/upper-constraints.txt -r /opt/stack/new/nova/test-requirements.txt -e /opt/stack/new/nova
...
2018-01-25 17:25:41.469 | Collecting python-pcre===0.7 (from -c /opt/stack/new/requirements/upper-constraints.txt (line 398))
2018-01-25 17:25:41.484 |   Downloading python-pcre-0.7.tar.gz (52kB)
...
2018-01-25 17:26:00.474 |     x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -fno-strict-aliasing -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -fPIC -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c src/pcremodule.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/src/pcremodule.o -fno-strict-aliasing
2018-01-25 17:26:00.474 |     src/pcremodule.c:32:18: fatal error: pcre.h: No such file or directory
2018-01-25 17:26:00.474 |     compilation terminated.
2018-01-25 17:26:00.474 |     error: command 'x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc' failed with exit status 1"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2018-01-29 12:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

From http://logs.openstack.org/41/528441/6/check/tempest-full/7271146/controller/logs/devstacklog.txt.gz it seems that Jenkins is happy because it obtains a wheel.  It may not be able to compile from source if a compatible wheel was not available?

2018-01-29 05:03:24.941 | Collecting python-pcre===0.7 (from -c /opt/stack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt (line 398))
2018-01-29 05:03:25.576 |   Downloading http://mirror.sto2.citycloud.openstack.org/wheel/ubuntu-16.04-x86_64/python-pcre/python_pcre-0.7-cp27-cp27mu-linux_x86_64.whl'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-29 14:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry. The original stack.log was linked to the new log file which was generated after I applying this patch. Reloaded both log files again:
http://dd6b71949550285df7dc-dda4e480e005aaa13ec303551d2d8155.r49.cf1.rackcdn.com/bug1745935/

stack_failed.log - the failed log
stack.log - the successful log with this patch applied.'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-30 01:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

pkvm: recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-01-30 02:58:50.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's cover this in I59fc688519341c90dc33b79d536f0625a6c4dd17 -- it was actually first, but it also has the RPM packages.  I'm going to remove this from the queue for clarity"}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:12:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Make libpcre3-dev as general prerequisite package

As python-pcre is now added in the upper-constraints.txt and
python-pcre depends on libpcre3-dev, we should include libpcre3-dev
as the general prerequisite package.

Change-Id: Idd5778282bf385682f6ebde1a96c980170475fce
Closes-Bug: #1745935

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7dd1584cc281844dfb4a9c60d5763f94d9d8ac13

commit_message:
Update env template

When update env template with existing name, 'exc.HTTPConflict'
should be raised.

Change-Id: Icaa8f6d0383bf9951a982d3ba4f1d86ca1c2457c

[{'created': '2018-01-25 23:29:58.000000000', 'message': 'Sync services on roles/Telemetry.yaml

The standalone Telemetry role at roles/Telemetry.yaml had an incorrect list of
services. The list has been updated to remove services such as MySQL and
RabbitMQ and the services common to all TripleO roles have been added.

Change-Id: I2e3f84ac61eec8dd49cd30ca19b6ebbe25735e27
Closes-Bug: #1745503

commit_message:
Sync services on roles/Telemetry.yaml

The standalone Telemetry role at roles/Telemetry.yaml had an incorrect list of
services. The list has been updated to remove services such as MySQL and
RabbitMQ and the services common to all TripleO roles have been added.

Change-Id: I2e3f84ac61eec8dd49cd30ca19b6ebbe25735e27
Closes-Bug: #1745503

subject: Improve content negotiation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 17130, 'name': 'melissaml', 'email': 'ma.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'malei'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-07-30 02:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-07-30 03:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2015-07-30 04:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

So it's not immediately obvious to me that 

"*/*, text/plain;q=0"

should NOT return text/plain.  Do you have the link to the relevant sections of RFC2616 handy - I'm guessing you had to read when trying to improve this?

Probably more useful - can you add a review comment as to *why* we're looking at this?  Like client ___ sent ___ expecting ___ and ____.  The last bit is the really interesting part - what broke and how bad.  While, cheap enough to just approve this change with a "seems right, tests pass" - it'd still be nice to have something to prioritize.

Also, is there a linter that accept header parsers can use to validate they're doing it right?  It'd be super cool if we could run the same tests lighttpd or nginx and other http servers use to validate their accept header parser?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2015-07-30 10:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm afraid I don't have any specific use-case in mind; this was just something I happened to notice while looking at edge cases for some similar functionality I'm writing. So probably low priority; I'd expect most clients really only want one format and do little with negotiation.

On to the RFC[1]! "The media type quality factor associated with a given type is determined by finding the media range with the highest precedence that matches the type", where "precedence" is defined as "If more than one media range applies to a given type, the most specific reference has precedence." So, text/plain should have a q value of 0 rather than the (default) 1 that */* has. And earlier, in the q value definition, "a value of 0 means 'not acceptable'."

[1] http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3

(Corresponding part of 2616 is http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616.html#section-14.1 with a cross-reference to http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616.html#section-3.9 if you'd prefer the old one.)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-30 21:32:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Agreed that it's not the highest-priority thing in the world, but it is a spot where Swift isn't entirely living up to its end of the HTTP bargain, and I'm happy to see it improved."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2015-11-03 21:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

well, if the code was trivial I'd probably spend less time worrying about it. 

But if no clients are complaining now it seems like there may be a higher risk of regression than potential value in trying to case after some version of "better" that's not based on requirements.

@tim - thanks for the RFC links

... if you update the test infrastructure so I can play around with some additional scariness I might be able to come up with something that triggers than name == 'q' bug (or something else).'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2015-11-04 00:45:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Improve content negotiation

Previously, Accept headers like "*/*, text/plain;q=0" would still return
text/plain.

Change-Id: I42cd521d5e07470ce11abe4817ff85beea760b21

commit_message:
Remove 'tools/install_venv.py' reference paragraph

Since 'tools/install_venv.py' has been removed during refactor[1].
This paragraph displayed in quickstart may cause some confusion to
someone who new to horizon, so remove this paragraph.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/horizon/commit/6529cd1eb8aef16b7ded96779c684644ed5a9fe0

Change-Id: I302ef1f30781ce916c7309ebfa349fbedf8dd5a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 20:47:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiattach policy names in release note

The policy rules pointed out in this release note were using
variables from the code, not the actual policy rule names that
are actually used in code and would be overridden in the policy
file.

Change-Id: I00ea8702327f5ad5083f97182098346093dd00ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiattach policy names in release note

The policy rules pointed out in this release note were using
variables from the code, not the actual policy rule names that
are actually used in code and would be overridden in the policy
file.

Change-Id: I00ea8702327f5ad5083f97182098346093dd00ee

subject: unnecessary equation
messages:
[{'account_id': 26589, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26251, 'date': '2018-01-29 10:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26498, 'date': '2018-01-29 11:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-29 14:18:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We don't have any styling guideline on this and the previous code has no problem, so I have no value in this. The called function uses keyword arg, so it is not special a caller uses keyword argument.

More worse, there are several demerits: (a) it pollutes the git history and this kind of change is annoying when using git blame, (b) it loses reviewer time (c) we cannot prevent this kind of things in a mechanical way.

It looks like a patch just to increase the number of commits. We would like to see actual bug fixes.

If other core reviewers would like to merge it, feel free to ignore me."}, {'account_id': 26589, 'date': '2018-01-30 01:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

ok i get it'}]

[{'created': '2018-01-29 19:15:12.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly mark earliest-version for release notes

This uses reno's `earliest-version` directive to explicitly point out
where the release notes for a given branch should begin. There is a bug
in reno when dealing with stable branches, where it does not always find
the correct version to begin with.

It also updates our release docs to indicate we should continue marking
this. This step can be removed when the reno bug is fixed, though it
doesn't hurt to continue marking this explicitly.

Change-Id: I6502ff95a52c2c855356e9875291f27ec44e7ffa
Related-Bug: #1746076
"}]
commit_message:
Explicitly mark earliest-version for release notes

This uses reno's `earliest-version` directive to explicitly point out
where the release notes for a given branch should begin. There is a bug
in reno when dealing with stable branches, where it does not always find
the correct version to begin with.

It also updates our release docs to indicate we should continue marking
this. This step can be removed when the reno bug is fixed, though it
doesn't hurt to continue marking this explicitly.

Change-Id: I6502ff95a52c2c855356e9875291f27ec44e7ffa
Related-Bug: #1746076

[{'created': '2018-01-25 03:24:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error

test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error,
debug the rootcause is due to update processed within a second,
so the stack_identifier's update_time will equal with the
stack's update_time, so it can not jump out of the loop,
will cause the timeout error
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat_integrationtests/common/test.py#L310-L311

This patch add a one second sleep to avoid this.

Change-Id: Iab1fab1875cb205e781475eb2deb308571dcf9a3
Closes-bug: #1745276

commit_message:
Fix test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error

test_create_update tests failed sometimes raise Timeout error,
debug the rootcause is due to update processed within a second,
so the stack_identifier's update_time will equal with the
stack's update_time, so it can not jump out of the loop,
will cause the timeout error
https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat_integrationtests/common/test.py#L310-L311

This patch add a one second sleep to avoid this.

Change-Id: Iab1fab1875cb205e781475eb2deb308571dcf9a3
Closes-bug: #1745276

nice to get rid of the custom theme'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2017-07-25 02:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-25 11:00:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1 Rollcall-Vote+1

nice'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-07-25 14:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-07-27 09:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Happy to get rid of the custom theme, however it makes a few things look a bit funny for "reference" website (not really documentation)

- The page title is "OpenStack Docs: OpenStack Technical Committee"
- The links "Docs home" and the "OpenStack Documentation" dropbox on the left-hand panel (would be better as "Governance home" and a dropbox of Governance websites; or we could get rid of the panel completely)
- Prominent mention of "2014.1.0.dev2498" version makes it look like it wasn't updated in the last 3 years
- Presence of a useless TOC at the top of the page content, distracting from key information

I have no idea how much a single theme could be further refined to support both the classic docs use case and the more... info website like use cases (releases.o.o, governance.o.o)... How much flexibility can we have here ?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-07-27 14:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Happy to get rid of the custom theme, however it makes a few things
 > look a bit funny for "reference" website (not really documentation)
 > 
 > - The page title is "OpenStack Docs: OpenStack Technical Committee"
 > - The links "Docs home" and the "OpenStack Documentation" dropbox
 > on the left-hand panel (would be better as "Governance home" and a
 > dropbox of Governance websites; or we could get rid of the panel
 > completely)
 > - Prominent mention of "2014.1.0.dev2498" version makes it look
 > like it wasn't updated in the last 3 years

Those are all good points. I will mark this WIP until the theme is updated to let us address them.

 > - Presence of a useless TOC at the top of the page content,
 > distracting from key information

The fix for that is in the latest version of the theme.

 > 
 > I have no idea how much a single theme could be further refined to
 > support both the classic docs use case and the more... info website
 > like use cases (releases.o.o, governance.o.o)... How much
 > flexibility can we have here ?

We should be able to make it work, we just need to add options to the theme.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-30 00:57:09.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'll redo this after the theme has the support we need."}]

commit_message:
switch to openstackdocstheme

Remove the inlined "custom" theme that was never changed from
oslosphinx and start using the openstackdocs theme like the other
documentation published by project teams.

Change-Id: I883d9a428f5ee108b855fda8279f505aea248822
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add a script to build zuul commands to reenqueue jobs

This script only generates the commands as a convenience, we still
need someone with infra-root privileges to run them.

Change-Id: I9870230509ad9f532f486b0682786d136ded798a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I45eacb91679af4117fb5b665b3726e1176fd2062

commit_message:
Use addOnException to capture server logs on failure

When a test fails, having access to the server logs can be useful. Add
an addOnException entry which runs add_log_details.

Update add_log_details to use dump_log from Server. Remove the use of
log.info in dump_log so that we can just capture the output and add it
as a test detail.

While we're in there, replace base functional tearDown with addCleanup.
addCleanup will run all cleanups, even if one of them throws an
exception.

Change-Id: I08b98f56ee3295b976d479685c73b3a20f8b5be0

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I507ee0a0fea861f3903323579b3839a891109de5

commit_message:
Mock sleep in UT

The test_create_disk_from_image test hits a code path that calls
time.sleep. However time.sleep is not mocked in the test. This reduces
the test runtime by mocking the sleep call.

Change-Id: I8c8ac89f5da955b7ac2459839c11283ff04fa283

Thanks. I wish I could convince myself not to emit notifications for traits stuff...'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-24 21:38:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Thanks Ruby. What do you think about Hironori's question - emitting the TraitList as an object vs. pulling out the strings into a list?

Here's an example notification:

{
    "event_type": "baremetal.node.update.start",
    "message_id": "7c386196-58ff-4d80-b029-41c7ee62cebc",
    "payload": {
        "ironic_object.changes": [
            "traits"
        ],  
        "ironic_object.data": {
            "boot_interface": null,
            "chassis_uuid": null,
            "clean_step": {},
            "console_enabled": false,
            "console_interface": null,
            "created_at": "2018-01-23T22:38:29Z",
            "deploy_interface": null,
            "driver": "fake",
            "driver_info": {},
            "extra": {},
            "inspect_interface": null,
            "inspection_finished_at": null,
            "inspection_started_at": null,
            "instance_info": {},
            "instance_uuid": null,
            "last_error": null,
            "maintenance": false,
            "maintenance_reason": null,
            "management_interface": null,
            "name": null,
            "network_interface": "neutron",
            "power_interface": null,
            "power_state": null,
            "properties": {},
            "provision_state": "enroll",
            "provision_updated_at": null,
            "raid_interface": null,
            "resource_class": "rc1",
            "storage_interface": "noop",
            "target_power_state": null,

@Mark, Hironori. That's a good question. I guess it depends on who is consuming the notification and what they want to do with the data.

As far as I'm concerned, we return the node.traits as a list of strings in our API. Just because we implemented it as Trait objects or whatever, shouldn't matter to the user. Even if we changed the Trait object to v1.3, as long as node.traits doesn't change (a list of strings), it seems to me that it should stay as that NodePayload version. And that example helps -- looking at it made me think 'ugh' :)

What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-01-24 23:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add traits field to node notifications

Adds a traits field to node notifications, and triggers notifications
when node traits are added or removed. Node traits are emitted in
notifications as a list of trait name strings.

Bumps the following notification payload versions:

NodePayload: 1.6
NodeSetPowerStatePayload: 1.6
NodeCorrectedPowerStatePayload: 1.6
NodeSetProvisionStatePayload: 1.6
NodeCRUDPayload: 1.4

Change-Id: I4e0333173250a641b317d466e52742cf7728ed90
Partial-Bug: #1722194

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 23:26:11.000000000', 'message': 'Raise on API errors getting aggregates/traits

Previously in the SchedulerReportClient, _get_provider_aggregates and
_get_provider_traits would log a warning and return None on placement
API errors.  The callers were ignoring these errors, resulting in the
internal ProviderTree representation potentially being out of sync with
reality.

With this change set, these two methods raise exceptions on API errors.

Change-Id: I20fe0d895f61ec83759cf880a87238ecc43c08f5

'}, {'created': '2018-01-04 23:06:44.000000000', 'message': "Raise on API errors getting aggregates/traits

Previously in the SchedulerReportClient, _get_provider_aggregates and
_get_provider_traits would log a warning and return None on placement
API errors.  The callers were ignoring these errors, resulting in the
internal ProviderTree representation potentially being out of sync with
reality.

With this change set, these two methods raise exceptions on API errors.
As currently implemented, these errors will bubble up into the resource
tracker and compute manager in the same way as other unhandled
exceptions.  That is, they land in the trap in
update_available_resource_for_node, where they are logged and otherwise
ignored.

Why is this an improvement?  Because at least the routine that
encountered the error doesn't continue on as if nothing went wrong.  (We
could have dealt with this by having the callers check for None
explicitly, but this approach was deemed more rigorous and robust.)

Change-Id: I20fe0d895f61ec83759cf880a87238ecc43c08f5

internal ProviderTree representation potentially being out of sync with
reality.

With this change set, these two methods raise exceptions on API errors.
As currently implemented, these errors will bubble up into the resource
tracker and compute manager in the same way as other unhandled
exceptions.  That is, they land in the trap in
update_available_resource_for_node, where they are logged and otherwise
ignored.

Why is this an improvement?  Because at least the routine that
encountered the error doesn't continue on as if nothing went wrong.  (We
could have dealt with this by having the callers check for None
explicitly, but this approach was deemed more rigorous and robust.)

Change-Id: I20fe0d895f61ec83759cf880a87238ecc43c08f5

commit_message:
Raise on API errors getting aggregates/traits

Previously in the SchedulerReportClient, _get_provider_aggregates and
_get_provider_traits would log a warning and return None on placement
API errors.  The callers were ignoring these errors, resulting in the
internal ProviderTree representation potentially being out of sync with
reality.

With this change set, these two methods raise exceptions on API errors.
As currently implemented, these errors will bubble up into the resource
tracker and compute manager in the same way as other unhandled
exceptions.  That is, they land in the trap in
update_available_resource_for_node, where they are logged and otherwise
ignored.

Why is this an improvement?  Because at least the routine that
encountered the error doesn't continue on as if nothing went wrong.  (We
could have dealt with this by having the callers check for None
explicitly, but this approach was deemed more rigorous and robust.)

Change-Id: I20fe0d895f61ec83759cf880a87238ecc43c08f5
blueprint: nested-resource-providers
